programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: With their children now leading independent lives, Kevin and Monique Dixon want to buy a holiday home on Florida's Gulf Coast, where they can enjoy the sailing and outdoor life as the UK winters begin back home. With £285,000 to spend, presenter Ben Hillman shows them five waterside homes.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Tim and Irene Foster find a property on the Cape Peninsula with a budget of £240,000. Irene comes from Cape Town and dreams of seeing her family more often.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: With their children now leading independent lives, Kevin and Monique Dixon want to buy a holiday home on Florida's Gulf Coast, where they can enjoy the sailing and outdoor life as the UK winters begin back home. With £285,000 to spend, presenter Ben Hillman shows them five waterside homes.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Kendal and Andy Strong first visited Lanzarote 10 years ago and a recent trip back and a particularly beautiful sunset re-ignited their love for the island. Now the pair are determined to buy their very own holiday home, so armed with a budget of £75,000, Jonnie Irwin shows them five potential properties, including some away from their favourite spot of Playa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: A few years ago, Marie Ash had a holiday romance on Fuerteventura. It didn't last, but her love for the island did. Now Marie has decided the island would be the perfect place for her and her eight-year-old son to spend quality time together in the school holidays. Scarlette Douglas shows Marie - and her best friend Helen - how far her £90,000 budget will go.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer revisits two couples he helped look for their perfect properties. Rebecca and Joe from Warwickshire needed a family home with space for their three racing camels, and did not want to move too far from their friends and good schools. In Essex, Steve and Dee had £1million to spend, but a long list of requirements, including a swimming pool and a squirrel-shaped hedge.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help more people trying to buy a home, beginning in west London. Newlyweds Keon and Zoe are looking for a family house in Shepherd's Bush with space for their hobby of salsa dancing, but even with a budget of £450,000 this will be a challenge for Phil. Kirstie is scouting for properties in the borough of Richmond for Carolyn and Paul - a native of Sheffield who is struggling to get his head around London's inflated prices.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to reverse the fortunes of a diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cook's work is being undone by the manager's marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room in Monrovia, California, and within minutes of his arrival, is caught in the crossfire of an argument between the owner, his wife and their children, all of whom are feeling the pressure of working seven days a week. Can the chef save the business and mend the warring family's frayed relationships?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the coastal community of Long Beach, California, to save an Italian restaurant that was opened in 1958 and now under the misguided leadership of Nino, who blamed by brother Michael and sister Carina for the eatery's failings. Their 78-year-old mother Inge desperate for Nino to turn the business around, but the feuding family members will have to solve their differences first.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on the fall-out from the General Election, Come Dine with Me and the classic Robin Williams film Mrs Doubtfire.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Jordan finds himself in charge of a baby that he has to sneak into school, but it is harder to conceal than he first anticipated, so blackmails PE teacher Steve into helping him out. Unable to return it to its mother, a stumped Steve ends up taking Jordan and the baby back to his house. Meanwhile, Missy agrees that if Cory sleeps with Nas, she will sleep with Cory. However, she soon discovers Cory has a loose tongue and that the whole school now thinks this is an open opportunity.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A distressed woman arrives at Luton police station, where officers from Bedfordshire Police's Safeguarding Unit reveal to her that her 76-year-old husband is under arrest and in custody following allegations of historical child sex abuse dating back to the 1970s. Cameras follow every twist and turn of the process as detectives investigate the veracity of the allegations to find out if they there is enough evidence to build a case.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eighteen-year-old Lewis is rushed into the hospital after coming off his motorbike and colliding with two cars. He is immediately taken for a full body CT scan as doctors are concerned about the extent of the injuries to his pelvis, arm and head. Meanwhile, 27-year-old Sam awaits X-ray results after he fainted and cut his lip while smoking a Cuban cigar at a barbecue.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after being involved in a road traffic collision, with consultants concerned that she may have life-threatening internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 80-year-old Mohammad has come to A&E after falling at home during a family Eid celebratory feast, and 56-year-old Russ is brought in after falling from a ladder while cutting back some trees at work.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Women's Hospital faces a bed crisis, so shift leader Sarah and the midwives have to juggle and prioritise to ensure everyone gets the care they need. Among those facing a wait is 34-year-old home care assistant Kristina, whose twins need to be delivered as quickly as possible and will need special attention.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets an animal lover who has had her eyes tattooed black to look like a horse, and her tongue split to mimic a snake's. The programme also features a former party girl who wants to ditch her double-F boob job, and a woman who wants to boost her breasts by six cup sizes. Plus, a Birmingham woman buys her partner a sub-dermal implant, while one lady wants to lose her tummy tattoo, and another seeks to have an intimate inking removed.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman brings in Teddy the shih-tzu cross, who has severely deformed front legs. His owner wants him to live a life without pain, but coming up with a surgical solution proves a challenge. Five-year-old golden retriever Ollie is referred to Fitzpatrick's for an operation to remove a tumour in his leg, and a young couple bring in their four-month-old bulldog, which suffered a fractured elbow after wriggling from their arms.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues his travels across America saving failing restaurants from disaster. In the first of two visits to Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, the chef encounters Joe Nagy, who claims he has the best menu from New York to Los Angeles. However, his servers and diners tell a different story, and his resistance to change leads to some explosive confrontations.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples in north London try to outdo one another by hosting the perfect dinner party, which is then judged by their rivals, with the winners earning a £1,000 prize. Joy and Jerry hope to wow their guests with a show-stopping menu inspired by their travels, while young couple Becca and Ricky have some struggles in the kitchen, and firefighting husband and wife team Sian and Tim put together a Thai-themed night for their guests.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick boss Nathan considers a deal on a diamond tennis bracelet, while Dan and Ellie at London Road make offers on a vintage trumpet, a mechanical digger and a gold pocket watch.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan Hatfield inspects a diamond eternity ring and a Victorian gold chain, a pair of very unusual painted cabinets featuring Salvador Dali and Frankenstein's monster, and a huge collection of boxing memorabilia. In Kent, siblings Charlie and Patrick Devine look at a gold disc that once belonged to rock band Oasis.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Presenters Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two couples who wanted to settle down in Edinburgh. Professional rugby player Matt and his girlfriend Amy looked at more than 100 properties in their quest for the perfect home, while parents Sarah and Dom wanted to relocate from London to be closer to the new mother's family.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Shoes in Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub and B&B is the right fit for their guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marlon Williams hosts the first party in Oxford, and hopes his love-island-themed evening will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, after a shambolic start to proceedings, the night ends with the smashing of plates.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Inventor Richard Berrecloth hosts the second dinner party in Oxford, and hopes to impress his guests with home-made food and an unusual form of entertainment. However, Heidi Kelloway and Marlon Williams appear to be more interested in each other than their host's hospitality - while another diner seems rather too keen on sampling the wine.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Victoria Collett hosts the third dinner party in Oxford and begins the day with a hangover and a few culinary disasters. It is not long before her guests start grumbling and Richard Berrecloth criticises her seafood starter, so she pins her hopes on the Caribbean curry being a success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog trainer James Hearle hosts the fourth dinner party in Oxford, but his four-legged friends threaten to turn the evening into a mess. Tempers also rise between the guests as culinary critic Richard Berrecloth continues shocking the group with his brutal honesty.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Heidi Kelloway hosts the final dinner party in Oxford, determined to lighten the mood of the other diners. However, the evening turns sour when the diners confront the overly critical Richard Berrecloth about his frank comments, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room in Monrovia, California, and within minutes of his arrival, is caught in the crossfire of an argument between the owner, his wife and their children, all of whom are feeling the pressure of working seven days a week. Can the chef save the business and mend the warring family's frayed relationships?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two couples who wanted to buy dream starter homes. Paul and his bride Alissa took 18 months to find a property in Windsor, Berkshire, but with a baby on the way, size is now an issue. In London, the duo catch up with Takie and Amy, who took out a huge mortgage on a property three years earlier, to see how they are faring.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Astronaut-in-training Nicky hopes to find romance with well-travelled motoring journalist Daniel. The restaurant also welcomes road sweeper Bruce, whose date is mother of two Yvonne. After years of being single, she's ready to put herself first and to find that one true love to keep her company into her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Phil Wang who take on guest captain Russell Howard and Roisin Conaty. programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Rory faces embarrassment in the showers on his first day at high school. Bridget interferes in Kerry's personal affairs and Principal Gibb offers Cate a job as a school nurse. Comedy, starring Katey Sagal and Amy Davidson.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: The girls grow suspicious of their mother's change of image - especially as she has also bought a new bed. Meanwhile, Kerry is unsure what to do about her current boyfriend. Comedy, starring Katey Sagal and Amy Davidson.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Kerry's secret is accidentally broadcast to the whole school, and both she and Bridget question Cate's motives for taking the job as school nurse - but Rory is pleased that she will be on hand to rescue him from a bully.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael agrees to sit in on keyboards with old friend and former bandmaster Johnny `Saxophone' Watson, only to find his musical skills have started to get a little rusty through disuse. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay suspects there is a mouse in the house when she finds droppings and demands that Michael hire an exterminator.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael resorts to bribing his family in an effort to get time alone in the house, giving Claire money to go shopping and watch a video with Kady. However, a power cut soon jeopardises his chance for solitude. Starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay nominates Michael for the Small Businessman of the Year award and he assumes he is going to win it after his close friend on the board hints that it is a done deal.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jay and Michael return from a night out to find Junior and his new girlfriend Vanessa in a compromising position. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part two of two. After catching Junior and his girlfriend Vanessa getting up to no good, Michael and Jay throw him out of the house, and he ends up living in a tent in the back garden until everything has calmed down.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael is recruited for jury service and elected foreman, but tries to get the trial over quickly so he can rush home to watch a marathon showing of the Godfather films on TV. Unfortunately, he ends up having to rent the videos instead - and becomes convinced the Mafia are after him.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Junior and Claire find a wallet containing $500, and decide to keep it for themselves - but Michael and Jay disapprove, and insist on setting up a family court to decide the fate of the cash. Comedy, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire gets her learner driver's licence, but Michael is still reluctant to let her get behind the wheel.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay is dismayed to discover Michael still carries a photograph of an attractive former girlfriend in his wallet, and demands an explanation. Meanwhile, Franklin finds it hard to admit Aretha is actually a very talented singer.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay tries to spend more time with Michael by watching him play golf. Meanwhile, Junior asks Franklin for help with a college application - but ends up cheating.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: When Claire reveals she and Tony have decided to have sex, Michael and Jay panic and try everything to change the lovebirds' minds. Comedy, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing the housemates' reactions to the second eviction, as well as the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs and diary room visits. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents chase £4,500 owed to a shipping company by a car parts dealer in Lancashire, but when the debtor arrives, he tries to assault one of the officers. Max and Steve are in east London on a mission to collect over £2,000 owed to a housing association, and Paul and Ben are in north London where they attempt to evict two tenants who owe more than £7,000 in rent arrears.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The officers try to recover £13,000 owed by a high-performance car dealer in Birmingham, and in Wolverhampton the agents chase nearly £2,000 owed to a car hire company. Elsewhere, officers visit a family in Kent to try to collect more than £5,000, but an emotional backstory means they are forced to make a sensitive decision.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection. Kevin Stokes and Brian O'Shaughnessy try to collect a debt from a technology company, but with the director nowhere to be seen, the office manager does everything she can to prove the business is no longer trading. Stewart McCracken and Elmor Victor face a heartbreaking house repossession in Merseyside, where two landlords are forced to evict a tenant recovering from a brain tumour which has cost him his job and income.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: New series. Paul O'Grady hosts a revival of the dating show in which contestants must choose between three unseen suitors based on their answers to a series of questions. The first episode sees a woman from Southport and a man with an eight-inch beard asking the questions, while cameras also follow two strangers from different backgrounds on a blind date in Barcelona.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: Documentary about people living on benefits. Lisa spent seven years in prison for smuggling cocaine, and has been unemployed and on benefits ever since. James is dyslexic and surviving on only £13,000 a year, while Jai quit his job to move to the Scottish Highlands, where he has found little need for his benefit money.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on three couples living on benefits. They include Karen and Paul who once ran a launderette, but after losing their business they now struggle to get by on benefits. Yvonne and David are getting married and planning to make it the best day ever - despite only being paid in a year the same amount as the cost of the average UK wedding. Things are even more bleak for Brian and Rachel, however, as despite being together for 10 years, they cannot afford to move in together.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Sonia celebrates her freedom with Don Kaplan, but it soon becomes apparent that she is working to her own agenda. Unfortunately for her, so is the homicide detective.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Gang
programme.desc: Female gang members speak about their experiences, revealing the extreme lengths they must go to as they find their own roles within the male-dominated culture. One shows off the weapon cache she keeps close by for protection, while another reveals how she was seduced by a gang member at only 15, after which he forced her into prostitution through violence and manipulation. Plus, the `honey-trap' girls who set up rivals for robbery, the teens who hide weapons and destroy evidence for their gang, and the girlfriend left behind now that her partner is serving life for murder.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: America becomes obsessed with rich men having sex with lots of women and Kyle and Butters end up being labelled as sex addicts and placed in treatment.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The boys try to write the most offensive book ever - but when Stan's mum finds it, they pin the blame on Butters. However, their hapless friend is then hailed as a literary genius.(n)

programme.title: You're the Worst
programme.desc: Jimmy tries to cheer everyone up with a Halloween party in which they will confront their worst fears, with the aid of an all-male Spice Girls tribute band and an Ouija board app.(n)

programme.title: Idiotsitter
programme.desc: Kent fires Joy, so Billie and Gene go to extreme lengths to get her job back. Comedy, with Jillian Bell and Charlotte Newhouse.(n)

programme.title: The Magicians

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Junior grows tired of living in the garage and decides to look for a place of his own, helped by John - who is forced to dress up and pose as his grandmother in a desperate bid to fool a pushy estate agent.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Everyone knows it takes an Undercover Brother to foil The Man. This time, The Man has launched Operation Whitewash, a plot to undermine an African-American general's presidential ambitions. But with the Undercover Brother (Eddie Griffin) on the case, alongside his sexy sidekick, Sistah Girl (Aunjanue Ellis), the general is sure to see the inside of the Oval Office. The 70's fashion-fabulous duo dons the latest in country club attire to infiltrate The Man's plan and root out his evil accomplice the White She Devil (Denise Richards)(n)

programme.title: Sgt. Bilko
programme.desc: This big-screen treatment of the classic TV comedy has Steve Martin in the role of the wheeler-dealer US Army sergeant immortalised by Phil Silvers. Bilko's past catches up with him when his nemesis from Washington, Major Thorn, turns up at the base, bent on settling old scores. It looks as though the writing's on the wall for Bilko and his money-making schemes. Are his days at the base numbered...?(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Action drama in which 'Dirty' Harry Callahan returns to investigate an underground betting ring in which the participants gamble on the deaths of prominent San Francisco citizens. One such 'dead pool' list contains the names of a rock star, a film critic and a talk-show host, all of whom have been systematically murdered. As Callahan looks further into the murders, he finds another well-known name on the list - his own(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: Filmmakers Ryan Fleck and Anna Boden (Half Nelson) weave this introspective sports drama concerning a talented Dominican baseball player who longs to break into the American big league and earn the money needed to support his impoverished family. Miguel Santos is a talented pitcher who might just have what it takes to earn a prized spot on a Major League Baseball team, but before that happens he'll have to prove his worth in the minor leagues. Advancing into the United States' minor league system at the tender age of 19, Miguel is warmly welcomed into the small-town Iowa home of his host family, but can't help but struggle with language and cultural barriers despite the kindness of strangers. Subsequently forced to reevaluate his life's ambition after his once-trusty arm becomes unreliable, the previously single-minded pitcher gradually begins to question both the world he lives in and the role he has chosen to play in it(n)

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: In late sixties Minneapolis, physics professor Larry Gopnick watches helplessly as his perfect middle class life begins to fall apart spectacularly(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: In Terry Gilliam's inventive fantasy, the famed authors are cast as con artists who get caught up in a real-life fairy tale involving a haunted forest where girls have been disappearing. Matt Damon and Heath Ledger star in this whimsical adventure. Jonathan Pryce, Monica Bellucci, Peter Stormare, Lena Headey(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: Edie Falco and Angela Basset head the outstanding ensemble cast in this keenly drawn character study. Set in a northern Florida coastal town, it's the tale of an engaging collection of locals and their reactions to the arrival of real-estate developers who want a piece of their paradise.Timothy Hutton, Bill Cobbs. Written and directed by John Sayles(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Dean Corso, a book dealer working in New York, is asked to locate the three remaining copies of demonic manuscript - 'The Nine Gates Of The Kingdoms Of Shadows' by a wealthy collector. Before long everyone who comes into contact with the manuscripts ends up dead and his own life is in danger. The hunt soon turns into an obsession and a search for the truth about the manuscript's powers(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Director: Bryan Bertino. A young couple staying in an isolated vacation home are terrorised by three unknown assailants(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: This compelling drama details the unlikely friendship that develops between a bigoted Korean War veteran and an Asian teen who, under threat from some gangbangers, tries to steal his car: a cherry 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home in this nostalgic and moving romance(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic spanning a twenty-year period in the life of eccentric millionaire Howard Hughes, including the films, the women and his pioneering success as a world-class aviator. Visually stunning drama(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two ageing friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on holiday together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: Richard Gere and Bob Hoskins star in Francis Ford Coppola's panorama of love, crime and entertainment in this stylish gangster film, centred on the legendary Harlem Nightclub. (1984)(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Two best friends become rivals when they schedule their respective weddings on the same day(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: An elite cop protects a witness from a murderous cult(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: Volunteers
programme.desc: Comic romp in which a spoilt playboy gambler joins the Peace Corps in Thailand to avoid his creditors, but then finds himself embroiled with local black marketeers and the CIA(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA. Things begin to get sticky when the cross-dressing trio get stranded in a small town governed by a homophobic sheriff, but with some fashion tips here and some glitter there, they win the locals over(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Robert Aldrich's classic drama stars James Stewart as Frank Towns, pilot of a plane transporting workers and cargo from an oilfield back to town. Caught in a sandstorm, the plane crashes hundreds of miles off its course, and the radio is destroyed. As the days go by, all hope of rescue fades - until Heinrich Dorfmann announces he is an aeroplane designer and, by cannibalising the wrecked plane, he can build a craft to fly them to safety. The outstanding cast also includes Richard Attenborough, Peter Finch, Ernest Borgnine, Ian Bannen and Ronald Fraser(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves and Charlize Theron shine in this romance about a workaholic who falls for an eccentric woman. Sara (Theron) convinces Nelson (Reeves) that his fast-paced life is unsatisfying and invites him to live with her for a month so she can enlighten him. Greg Germann, Liam Aiken, Lauren Graham(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Hardboiled detective Max Payne obsessively hunts the murderer who killed his wife and child(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Reese and Finch receive the number for Shanghai-born events planner Kelli Lin, but the theft of a Cezanne painting at an exhibit she is involved in reveals her true identity as a gymnast-turned-criminal. Later, the team's attention is diverted to helping track down a missing girl. Drama, starring Jim Caviezel, Michael Emerson and Sarah Shahi.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Finch goes undercover at an emergency call centre in an attempt to protect the latest person called by the Machine, a 911 operator and trainee supervisor named Sandra Nicholson, but it soon becomes clear the threat goes further than he initially thought. Crime drama, starring Michael Emerson.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Flashback episode going back to a case in 2010. A freelance hacker is hired to test the Machine's security system, only to find some suspicious code - and end up bundled in the boot of an enemy car for his trouble. When he escapes, Finch hires Reese's gung-ho predecessor Rick Dillinger to protect the man - but Dillinger soon realises he is up against trained government agents who also want to track him down. Jim Caviezel, Michael Emerson and Joseph Mazzello star.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The shabby sleuth investigates the complex case of a murdered Hollywood gossip writer. He uses his unique talents to interrogate a smooth-talking funeral director, who was once romantically involved with the victim and one of the last people to see her alive. Detective drama, with Peter Falk. Patrick McGoohan co-stars and directs.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Trace of Murder
programme.desc: A conniving woman yearns to divorce her husband and set up home with her lover - but a pre-nuptial agreement means she stands to lose out. Instead, she devises a cunning plan to nullify the contract, framing her unsuspecting spouse for the murder of a business rival. However, she reckons without the shabby sleuth's unfailing ability to uncover the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Shera Danese, Barry Corbin and David Rasche.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: An Exercise in Fatality
programme.desc: The owner of a chain of health clubs kills a business partner who was about to expose his crooked dealings. Making the death look like an unfortunate weightlifting accident, he cunningly creates the perfect alibi using a tape recording of his victim's voice - but he reckons without the intervention of the shabby sleuth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Conrad and Philip Bruns.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride becomes convinced that Paul Jenks, the so-called `Baitfish' has returned. Jenks was the former informant who set a bomb that nearly killed Pride's daughter, and Pride is obviously highly motivated to track him down. However, his colleagues become increasingly concerned about the lengths to which he will go to catch his nemesis, including attempts to form an alliance with the Broussard crime family. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a sailor is shot in the champagne room of a strip club, the team links the murder weapon to two additional unsolved cases and discovers the names of all three victims appear on a mural in a dilapidated part of town. Meanwhile, Brody's ex-fiance pays her a surprise visit. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula, Zoe McLellan and Lucas Black.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Acting on a tip-off, Mac and the team discover old enemy Suspect X, a trained assassin, has resurfaced. In an attempt to stop the killer striking again, they set a trap to lure her into the open - and in the process make a chilling discovery about who was next on her list of victims. With Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella's life is endangered by an unexplained fire at her apartment building, and she is forced to evacuate everyone from the premises. Meanwhile, her fellow investigators deal with another mystery - in the form of a body discovered among the charred debris. With Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: During a surveillance operation, Fin stumbles on a robbery in a supermarket and almost loses his life. The incident results in him receiving unwelcome attention from the media, but also provides a chance to atone for past mistakes.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team investigates a nine-year-old's claims she has been molested by her football coach - and the inquiry prompts a string of other children to come forward with similar stories. Stabler struggles to cope with the case since it involves victims who are of a similar age to his daughters - and is taken aback by the child's subsequent confession that she lied about the identity of her abuser.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives encounter complications while investigating a case in which a would-be rapist was killed by his intended victim. Graffiti found at the scene of the death prompts Stabler and Benson to suspect a street artist - but the physical evidence seems to prove his innocence. Starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team reopens a 20-year-old case after receiving a letter pinpointing where the remains of a seven-year-old boy are located. Initial investigations focus on a serial killer who is on death row for murdering another child, but he denies ever touching the victim and the focus of the inquiry shifts when the last person to see the boy alive is found dead. Starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team is baffled by the violent murder of a prostitute who was knocked down by a car and beaten to death while talking on her phone in the street, until Stabler's son suggests the crime appears to be modelled on a scene from a popular video game. A trail of clues leads the squad to a teenage couple who claim to be unable to distinguish between fantasy and reality, but the one piece of evidence that could put them behind bars is not allowed to be used for fear of jeopardising an anti-terror investigation.(n)

programme.desc: A man is found stabbed to death in an alleyway, and the detectives discover he shined shoes for a living. They begin by looking for his most recent customers, and learn the victim was a Vietnam war veteran, shedding light on possible motives and suspects.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A wealthy widow and her daughter are implicated in the death of a hitman out on parole - and it's up to the squad to find out whether the pair hired the victim to kill a rich relative. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: Castle

programme.desc: A high-level insurance executive is murdered, and suspicion soon falls on the father of a dying nine-year-old whose claim for a life-saving leukaemia treatment was turned down. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.desc: Two room-mates are found bludgeoned to death in their flat, and the handyman is the prime suspect. Award-winning police drama, guest starring Gene Silvers, and Elisabeth Rohm.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: Sudden Impact
programme.desc: Classic gritty crime action starring and directed by the great Clint Eastwood. 'Dirty' Harry Callahan hunts for a vengeful murderer in the seaside town of San Paulo. Dir: Clint Eastwood(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Though ostensibly a family-oriented outing, Ivan Reitman's Kindergarten Cop ensures that fans of star Arnold Schwarzenegger's action films won't be disappointed by pumping up the Cop half of the equation to a surprisingly high degree. Schwarzenegger stars as John Kimble, an L.A. cop who learns that the ex-wife and son of his drug-dealer quarry Crisp (Richard Tyson) are living in secrecy in small-town Oregon. Kimble is partnered with Phoebe (Pamela Reed), a former teacher, who is slated to begin undercover work at the school where Crisp's ex is suspected of working under an assumed identity. However, Phoebe becomes ill, forcing rough, gruff Kimble to take over the kindergarten class instead(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Meg Altman buys an old brownstone apartment fitted with a 'panic room', a secret, state-of-the-art chamber to hide from burglars. She never thought she'd need it, until she heard the glass break downstairs... Stylish, suspense thriller(n)

programme.title: Manhunter
programme.desc: Before Anthony Hopkins made his mark in the role, Brian Cox starred as Hannibal Lecktor [sic], the psychopathic killer cannibal and before Jodie Foster, there was Will Graham (William Petersen), an Fbi profiler brought out of retirement to catch the family-murdering 'Tooth Fairy' in Michael Mann's unrelenting thriller. Tortured by his past with Lecktor, Graham must confront him again to learn about his new enemy(n)

programme.title: Point Break

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Harry experiences a bout of teenage angst as he harbours a crush on a fellow-student at Hogwarts. But a strange prophecy reveals itself, and Harry's wizard exams and raging hormones have to remain in the background as he is called into action once again(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Meg Altman buys an old brownstone apartment fitted with a 'panic room', a secret, state-of-the-art chamber to hide from burglars. She never thought she'd need it, until she heard the glass break downstairs... Stylish, suspense thriller(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots..(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: In his breakthrough Hollywood role, Robin Williams stars in Barry Levinson's black comedy as DJ Adrian Cronauer, assigned to the US Armed Services Radio station in Vietnam. His outrageous quip-laden, cynical broadcasting style, matched by his choice of records, immediately lands him in hot water with the top brass but his popularity with the soldiers in the field saves his bacon. But as the war comes closer to home (he barely survives a bomb attack) and he becomes involved with a Vietnam girlfriend, he is forced to take both himself and the war a little more seriously(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: Inspired by the story of young Jesus Christ on his return from Egypt to Nazareth with his family. As Jesus grows into his religious identity, his family also learn to understand his nature and purpose during the journey(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. Scientists have received a message from space which details the DNA structure of the alien race which has sent it, together with instructions on how to combine the alien DNA with that of a human being. Now an experiment is underway to do just this - until the little girl at the heart of the experiment breaks out of the laboratory and goes on the run. Growing up at an incredible speed, Sil is also developing some quite alien powers and presents a serious threat to the human population. A team of trackers - and assassins - has been despatched to eliminate her, but will they succeed before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm

Matt Damon and Heath Ledger star in this whimsical adventure. Jonathan Pryce, Monica Bellucci, Peter Stormare, Lena Headey(n)

programme.title: Half Past Dead

programme.title: The Dead Pool

One such 'dead pool' list contains the names of a rock star, a film critic and a talk-show host, all of whom have been systematically murdered. As Callahan looks further into the murders, he finds another well-known name on the list - his own(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: (2008) Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy and Morgan Freeman star in this violent action adventure from Russian director Timur Bekmambetov (Nightwatch, Daywatch). The life of office worker Wesley Gibson (McAvoy) has been one of frustration, disappointment and anxiety; he has an overbearing boss, his girlfriend and his best friend are duplicitously having an affair, and he's on medication to calm his nerves. To top it all, he one day finds himself on the wrong end of an assassination attempt. Luckily, the agile, honed and lethal Fox (Jolie) is at hand to save his life. However, she also reveals that his recently deceased father was secretly a supremely skilled killer, and that it's her job to ensure that Wesley takes his place in the Fraternity, the mystical organisation overseen by Sloan (Freeman), which exists to rid the world of evil-doers. And so begins Wesley's journey to unlock his hitherto unsuspected innate deadly abilities and use them for good. The cinematography echoes the inventiveness of Bekmambetov's earlier movies and takes a Matrix-like delight in playing with the tempo and camera angles of the fight scenes(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: New series. Topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with new presenters Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett introducing guest panellists and viewers' contributions.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Wonnacott invites two teams to scour Westpoint Antiques Fair outside Exeter, Devon for bargains to sell for profit at auction. Advice is provided by Philip Serrell and Caroline Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a basement flat in East Dulwich, south London, and properties in Ebbw Vale, Blaenau Gwent and Workington, Cumbria. They then speak to the new owners about their plans for the buildings, and find out how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and the team reclaim items from a recycling centre in Bredbury, Greater Manchester, with Guy Trench aiming to turn a rusty petrol can into a lighting fixture.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Elizabeth Talbot finds an early gramophone among the antiques at Stapleford Park in Leicestershire, while Mark Stacey reveals a fondness for big cats. Meanwhile, Paul Martin visits Thrumpton Hall in Nottinghamshire to examine its opulent Restoration staircase, and discovers a connection with Lord Byron through some interesting relics.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple looking for a property in rural Cheshire, and also visits the Anderson Boat Lift, which links the River Weaver and the Trent and Mersey Canal.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Tom Hollander presents an appeal on behalf of IntoUniversity, a charity that provides local learning centres in some of the UK's most deprived communities.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Connie Fisher joins the Street Angels of Magaluf as they patrol the Spanish party town, offering aid and advice to dusk-to-dawn revellers.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin face one of their biggest challenges yet as they try to help the Caan family from Glasgow, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their weekly food shop. Dad, Ryan is addicted to food shopping and loves to have a fridge bursting with food, while for convenience the family often opt for takeaways throughout the week too, sending their food bills spiraling out of control. Can Gregg and Chris get them cooking from scratch and ditch the takeaways?.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Sean Fletcher present the show from the Hay Festival, where they meet the event's organisers as well as writers and artists. Ellie also goes on a wildlife safari inspired by one of the featured books and joins a team spotting and tracking adders with radio transmitters. Plus, Adam Henson reports on technology for preventing droughts and John Craven presents an update on the Countryfile Photographic Competition.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns to BBC Caversham, near Reading, where objects brought in to be valued include a communion book that was originally owned by war poet Wilfred Owen, an Aston Martin sports car, and a finely embroidered 17th-century needlework box that creates a surprise when its value is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Verity anxiously awaits word of her husband, who is sailing for Lisbon, when news reaches Trenwith of a naval battle in which both he and Dwight may have been killed. Ross is reunited with a disreputable old friend of his father, who tells him that Dwight has been captured and is facing execution in France - prompting him to turn down the position of magistrate and sail to the rescue. Drake proposes to Sam that the Methodists can worship at the church, but the decision angers George, who has them driven from the building.(n)

programme.title: Thor: The Dark World
programme.desc: The alien thunder god returns to Earth when a powerful weapon from the dawn of time is discovered. The device attracts the attention of an old enemy of his people, who intends to use it to plunge the universe into darkness - and to stop him, Thor must form an uneasy alliance with his treacherous brother Loki. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tom Hiddleston and Natalie Portman.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Rav Wilding explores music festival ticket scams and Michelle Ackerley visits a North Yorkshire airfield to find out how police are combatting smuggling and people trafficking.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander looks round a three-bedroom flat in Croydon, London, and Martin Roberts talks to a couple buying a bungalow in Codnor, Derbyshire, for their retirement. Dion Dublin meets two friends investing in a former tattoo parlour complete with five bedsits in Stockton-on-Tees.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates fake safety marks on some of the UK's largest e-cigarette brands. Plus, the programme examines a counterfeit hair curler that is too dangerous to use, and imitation dental drills that were destined for British surgeries.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright meets two property tycoons who have fallen out over a guest house, and the enforcers also discover a whole terrace of homes threatened by Japanese knot weed.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp oversees proceedings as Tim Weeks and Caroline Hawley help two teams look for items at the South of England Showground in Ardingly, West Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha is furious when she finds out that Emma has had a run-in with a supposedly reformed Bren, while Ruhma bonds with Mrs Tembe and asks her for a big favour.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple who have £400k to fulfil their dream of moving to Dorset. Her visit to the county is timed to coincide with the 2015 British Beach Polo Championship.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Aiden Byrne puts three home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, one of which is to fillet a piece of fish perfectly. Sheree Murphy hosts.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Irina Aggrey collect donated items for an auction in Llanidloes, Powys, to help raise funds for a woman who works tirelessly for others while battling cancer.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Supersize Cabbies
programme.desc: Following obese Plymouth taxi drivers Roger Laughton and Mike Davis as they take on a punishing programme of diet and exercise devised by fitness trainer Gavin Seymour. Mike is 20st and the challenge is about overcoming the overeating that started when he was bullied as a child for wearing a hearing aid, and he wants to be a fit dad as his first child is due any day. At nearly 31st, Roger's health is already on the edge due to the impact of obesity and his goal is survival as he tries to shed half his body weight. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Steven does his best to reach out to Ian on Father's Day, only to end up feeling rejected, while Abi's jealousy toward her sister grows when Jack and Lauren work together on a surprise for Max. Sharon takes it upon herself to uncover the truth of what happened between Louise and Keegan, Lily accidentally lets a big secret out of the bag, and Ted and Joyce are upset when their daughter cancels her visit.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: London Tower Fire: How Did It Happen? - Panorama.
programme.desc: The fire believed to have started on the fourth floor of Grenfell Tower in Kensington, west London, engulfed almost the entire 24-storey building at shocking speed. Richard Bilton investigates what happened that night, examining why residents' fears about safety were apparently ignored and why the flames spread so quickly through the block.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace returns with the programme that goes behind the scenes with Britain's biggest food retailers, finding out how they are using the latest science and technology to stay ahead of the competition. Gregg discovers the hi-tech acoustic testing Asda are using to get an edge in the battle to bring customers the perfect avocado, while Babita Sharma learns about the intelligence gatherers who know more about what shoppers buy and why than they do.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: An extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with stand-up comedian Phil Wang one of the two guests joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by Hollywood star Mark Wahlberg, currently promoting Transformers: The Last Knight and British actor Tom Holland, the titular star of Spider-Man: Homecoming. Plus, Woody Harrelson and Andy Serkis reflect on their new offering, War for the Planet of the Apes, and Sienna Miller talks about Cat on a Hot Tin Roof at the Young Vic. Alison Moyet performs Reassuring Pinches, while the host subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter Q, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and designer Danny Clarke have just one day to transform a grey and windswept roof terrace in Basingstoke into a cosy and colourful outdoor room for owner Aimee.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 50th anniversary at Gardeners' World Live at Birmingham's NEC. Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the show gardens and meet a designer who has created a garden showcasing 50 years of changing trends. Carol Klein looks at the plants that have defined the decades, while Rachel de Thame, Flo Headlam, Alan Power, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane explore other features of the event. Main host Monty Don catches up with predecessor Alan Titchmarsh to discuss the series, while Mary Berry reveals the winner of the golden jubilee plant award.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Jim McColl tries to find a way to grow tomatoes, peppers and cucumbers side by side in his domestic-size greenhouse - not an easy task with limited space. Carole Baxter and George Anderson get out their pruning saws to cut back the woodland garden, and Brian Cunningham visits the meticulous Pitmedden Gardens in Aberdeenshire to find out how head gardener Susan Burgess tackles the problem of Box Blight with the six miles of clipped box hedging of which she is in charge.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The rural current affairs series visits Northern Ireland, where Joe Crowley heads into the woods near Belfast to help members of the RSPB tag swifts. He also tours a farm where physalis, mustard flowers and Asian radishes are found growing alongside the usual fare of potatoes, carrots and cauliflowers. Ellie Harrison takes in sites associated with St Patrick on Church Island, and Adam Henson finds out why herdwick sheep are being used to graze on ground where some of the UK's rarest plants are found.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing the Central regions, Pip Lacey, Ryan Simpson and Nick Deverell-Smith, go all out to impress with their main courses. Ryan hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a banquet-worthy dish, while Pip pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, and Nick celebrates venison in his main course.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Central chefs - Pip Lacey, Nick Deverell-Smith and Ryan Simpson - prepare their desserts, knowing this is the last chance to impress before one of them has to leave the competition. Two of them use pineapple, in reference to the fruit on top of the Wimbledon men's singles trophy, while the third celebrates the summer ice-cream van. Which two will make it through to tomorrow?.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Jordanne Whiley - who with Yui Kamiji is the current Wimbledon wheelchair doubles holder - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, focusing on items suitable for picnics, including Paul Hollywood's quail's egg pork pies.(n)

programme.title: Sailing
programme.desc: Shirley Robertson presents action from races one and two of the prestigious event in Bermuda, as Oracle Team USA look to triumph for the third successive occasion.(n)

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v Castleford Tigers (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Chapman presents coverage of the concluding quarter-final, which takes place at the KCOM Stadium. The hosts are the defending champions after their dramatic victory in last year's final against Warrington Wolves, but they start as underdogs against the Tigers, who have been the outstanding side in this season's Super League.(n)

programme.title: Rowing World Cup
programme.desc: Matthew Pinsent is joined by Katherine Grainger to present highlights of the latest regatta of the season from Poznan, Poland.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: The concluding episode of the documentary about the construction of the Crossrail train line linking east and west London follows the work of engineers building 10 new stations. A team battles to put together the giant jigsaw that will become a cathedral-sized station at Canary Wharf. The structure is so big it has to be erected underwater in a dock, while the roof comes in a kit of more than 2,500 pieces. As the underground caverns that will become the new stations are carved out, workers uncover gruesome reminders of the city's past.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A merchant navy officer-turned-product designer demonstrates his tablet holder, while two proud parents pitch their organic skincare product for babies. A young entrepreneur hopes to impress with his activity monitor for pets, but will the Dragons see the potential in his innovative product, or will he be left in the dog house? Presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A nurse living in Nottingham whose husband is in the army has rarely settled for long in one place and would like to move somewhere with a sense of community. She trades places with a B&B owner from Alaska, who is hoping to escape her small-town life and see more of the world as she approaches retirement.(n)

programme.title: Theresa v Boris: The Battle to be PM
programme.desc: Docu-drama telling the story of the Conservative Party's 2016 leadership campaign, from the day David Cameron resigned to the day Theresa May became Prime Minister. Based on exhaustive research and first-person testimonies, this dramatised narrative goes beyond the headlines to lay bare the politicking and positioning, betrayals and blunders of this extraordinary political time. The programme also features key interviews with people who were intimately involved in the campaigns of the main contenders.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Zoe Lyons. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent is nominated for Entrepreneur of the Year in the Essex Business Awards and immediately splashes out a table for the company. But first he must face his wife, who confronts him about rumours she heard linking him and their son's primary school teacher. Meanwhile, Vincent and Lavender discover that Fitzpatrick is a CB radio enthusiast, and cannot resist going undercover to dupe him.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: Pakistan v India. Action from the final at The Oval in south London, which provided the setting for the climax of the eighth staging of the tournament.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Bauhaus-Galan. Gabby Logan presents action from the sixth meeting of the Diamond League series, held at the Stockholm Olympic Stadium in Sweden.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Coventry, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: It's crunch time for Mo, who has some difficult life choices to make, and a patient who is dear to Ric forces him to try and mend some broken ties. Meanwhile, Jasmine has growing suspicions of Fran's intentions with Jac - could she be on to something?.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British surf lifesaver launches a rescue mission after a diver goes missing on Bondi Beach and police officers from Blighty hunt burglars in the gold-mining town of Kalgoorlie.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant are on hand as two teams test their antiques knowledge at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire. Eric Knowles hosts.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Bryn Williams, Kim Woodward, Ryan Simpson and Atul Kochhar pair up with their chosen home cook partners, with Pierre Koffmann on hand to judge their final dishes.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second show from New Lanark on the banks of the Clyde, where items brought in to be valued include diamonds that were found after being hidden inside an upholstered chair, a claret jug that was rescued from a pawn shop, and a banner for Britain's oldest subscription library, founded in 1741.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Bauhaus-Galan. Gabby Logan presents action from the sixth meeting of the Diamond League series, held at the Stockholm Olympic Stadium in Sweden.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The AEGON Championships. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the opening day of the famous grass-court tournament, as the men's singles gets under way at Queen's Club. Current world number one Andy Murray won here last year for the fifth time in his career, surpassing the record set by seven other players, including the likes of John McEnroe, Boris Becker and Andy Roddick, to become the outright most successful man in the tournament's history. Murray began his campaign last year with a triumph against Nicolas Mahut, edging through in two tie-breaks to reach the last 16. With commentary by Andrew Castle, Andrew Cotter, John Lloyd and Peter Fleming, and reports from John Inverdale.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: New series. Kate Humble hosts a panel show that tests the wildlife knowledge of teams captained by Springwatch presenter Chris Packham and zoologist Lucy Cooke across a variety of intriguing rounds. Iolo Williams and Lizzie Daly are the first guests, with every correct answer wins part of a mysterious animal and as the show progresses each team builds its very own bespoke beast that they must correctly identify the parts of in the endgame, while the show is packed with breathtaking natural history clips, extraordinary animal facts and spirited debate.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer and former Great British Bake Off judge celebrates the everyday food and ingredients she has always loved, from hearty and wholesome ideas to dishes that are a little bit more indulgent. Mary begins by travelling to Scotland to enjoy the best of the country's staple foods, preparing recipes inspired by her own Scots heritage. She discovers wonderful shellfish in Ullapool, joins chef Tom Kitchin to share the joy of venison cooked on a barbecue and whips up her special whisky cream on the banks of a loch.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the Northern Ireland heats sees returning contender Eddie Attwell and newcomers Joery Castel and Tommy Heaney prepare their starters for the banquet. Eddie is using a number of modern techniques, Joery hopes to impress with a tribute to 1996 Wimbledon champion Richard Krajicek, while Tommy creates a warm salad. Who will win the favour of the veteran judge?.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future.
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: New series. The Victorian crime drama returns for its fifth and final series. Only days after the murder of Inspector Bennet Drake, his friends Edmund Reid, Homer Jackson and Long Susan are drawn together to bring his murderer - a new serial killer stalking Whitechapel's streets - to justice. But they themselves are now being hunted by the police and Assistant Commissioner Augustus Dove has hired Jedediah Shine to take charge of Leman Street police station. Starring Matthew Macfadyen.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The police investigate a huge hole that has been excavated, and Larry Bishop's invisible dogs have disappeared. Meanwhile, Andy and Lance have one last chance to pursue their hearts' desires. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Sailing
programme.desc: Shirley Robertson presents action from races three and four of the prestigious event in Bermuda, as Oracle Team USA look to triumph for the third successive occasion.(n)

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.sub-title: Secret Knowledge: Nina Simone & Me with Laura Mvula.
programme.desc: The soul singer travels to New York City to explore the songs made famous by Simone that mean the most to her, and trace the late singer's musical roots with the help of those who knew the `High Priestess of Soul'. Laura reveals the influence of Nina's classical training, meets Simone's long-time guitarist Al Shackman and performs with a Harlem gospel choir as she pays tribute to the genius of her musical heroine.(n)

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2017
programme.sub-title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World 2017 Final.
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and Angel Blue present the final of the opera singing contest live from St David's Hall, joined by soprano Danielle de Niese and baritone Gerald Finley. The five remaining singers perform, accompanied by the BBC National Orchestra of Wales, before the event's patron Kiri te Kanawa announces the winner. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: Doris Day: Virgin Territory
programme.desc: A profile of the American singer, actress and animal rights activist, featuring contributions by James Garner, Richard Carpenter, Terence Davies and Don Pippin. The programme delves into the troubled private life and career highs and lows of the star of such films as Pillow Talk, Calamity Jane, That Touch of Mink, The Thrill of It All and Caprice. Narrated by Michael Brandon.(n)

programme.title: Buddy Holly: Rave On
programme.desc: Rock 'n' roll started with Elvis, but some believe that pop music started with Buddy Holly and the Crickets. As a songwriter, Holly revolutionised the genre by introducing dynamic new rhythms and unpredictable melodies beyond its traditional blues roots. In his songs written and recorded in the late '50s, it is already possible to hear the beat group sound of the 1960s, and beyond. This documentary tells the story of Holly's tragically short life and career through interviews with those who knew him and worked with him. Contributors include Don McLean, Paul Anka, Don Everly, Hank Marvin and Bob Harris.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Who's Afraid of a Big Black Hole?.
programme.desc: Black holes are considered to be among some of the most destructive forces in the universe, capable of swallowing stars and tearing planets apart. However, they are also invisible by definition, and difficult to study. This documentary examines the work of astronomers and theoretical physicists who are trying to map a black hole, in the hope of discovering whether they are the key to solving the mystery of what existed before the Big Bang.(n)

programme.title: Voyager: To the Final Frontier
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell tells the story of the Voyager Space Mission, which saw two unmanned spacecraft leave Earth to explore the farthest reaches of the solar system. The probes were launched in 1977, and became the first man-made objects to visit Jupiter, Saturn, Neptune and Uranus. Having travelled 11 billion miles to date, the pair now journey beyond the influence of Earth's sun, bearing a record of human civilisation in case of discovery by other species.(n)

programme.title: The Magic of Mushrooms
programme.desc: Professor Richard Fortey examines the world of mushrooms in a specially built laboratory with the help of mycologist Dr Patrick Hickey. Together, they reveal the ability of fungi to break down waste and sustain new plant life, keeping the planet alive. Richard also travels across Britain and further afield to reveal their mysterious life cycles and how they have the potential to open new frontiers in science, medicine and technology.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Battle for the Himalayas: The Fight to Film Everest.
programme.desc: Documentary charting the story of how film-makers used the Himalayan mountains for propaganda, as the world's great powers sent military-style expeditions to conquer the peaks between the 1920s and the 1960s. As a result, some of the range's most iconic mountaineering feats have been captured on film, including the preparations for Mallory and Irvine ill-fated ascent of Mount Everest in 1924, and the final conquest of the mountain by Hillary and Tenzing in 1953.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a new journey following his Bradshaw's handbook from the heart of the industrial East Midlands to the island of Lindisfarne off the coast of Northumberland. On the first leg, he gives an old engine a fresh start in the railway hub of Derby, heads to Nottingham to find out about the Victorian origins of a well-known high-street chemist and calls at a historic one-time grocer's shop in Grantham, Lincolnshire.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby sails his yacht Rocket around the British coastline, exploring different aspects of the nation's maritime history, art and architecture along the way. He begins by sailing the south-west coast of Devon and Cornwall, where he tells the story of Sir Francis Drake and an array of adventurers, explorers, pirates and smugglers. He also welcomes record-breaking solo yachtswoman Ellen MacArthur on board and learns about one of the oldest maritime art forms of all - the tattoo, before agreeing to have one himself.(n)

programme.title: The Company Men
programme.desc: The feature debut from director John Wells stars Tommy Lee Jones, Chris Cooper and Ben Affleck as three company management types about to feel the sharp end of the global financial crash. All three work, at varying levels of the upper echelons, for the Boston global transportation systems giant GTX, which is keen to boost its share prices. But in the middle of a recession that's not easy - so it opts for a round of redundancies in a brutal downsizing programme. One of the first to go is sales director and family man Bobby Walker, who's offered a lifeline by his brother-in-law, self-employed carpenter Jack Dolan, but appears too proud to take it. And it's not long before Phil Woodward, who has risen to lofty heights from the shopfloor, and even the company's co-founder Gene McClary also find themselves on the wrong side of CEO James Salinger's balance sheet. It's a sober look at the impact of 2008's financial implosion and relentless capitalism, with fine, nuanced performances from the leads(n)
