programme.desc: Simon Rimmer helps a Swansea mother of three to make family meals including Korean chicken bites and chickpea stew, while Michela Chiappa reports on cooking with different oils.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A hillbilly's tirade about Springfield prompts Mayor Quimby to legalise same-sex marriage in the town. Homer sees the opportunity to cash in by getting ordained over the internet and conducting weddings himself. As scores of people come out of the closet, Marge's sister Patty makes a shock announcement.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: On a Clear Day I Can't See My Sister.
programme.desc: Bart drives Lisa to distraction on a school trip, tormenting her until she takes out a restraining order forbidding him to come within 20ft of her. Just to be on the safe side, she uses a pole to make sure he keeps his distance. Meanwhile, Grampa is hurt in an incident involving a garden gnome.(n)

programme.title: The Book of Life
programme.desc: Premiere. A man who longs to be a musician instead of a bullfighter like his father has to compete with a childhood friend when they fall for the same woman. Their love triangle catches the eye of the spirits of the dead, leading him on a journey through their bizarre world. Animated adventure, with the voices of Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana and Channing Tatum.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Retirement is fast approaching for Chris Wood and Eleanor Clements, who are looking for a holiday home on the coast of north Tenerife where they can spend the winter months. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, including some stunning cliff-top apartments, within their £120,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton explores the Menai Bridge in Anglesey, Wales, a smuggler's cottage, a working lighthouse that is also a family home, and a cliff-side residence overlooking Snowdonia.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Hotel
programme.desc: London's Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park host a flamboyant wedding ceremony, VIP guests including Morgan Freeman and Quincy Jones check in, and veteran concierge Francois-Xavier is asked to source a watch worth more than a quarter of a million pounds for one wealthy guest. Born-and-bred Londoner Paul starts work at the hotel, and must learn fast what it takes to be at the top of the five-star game, while Vanya is missing her boyfriend after eight months of working nights.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Timothy West and Prunella Scales explore India by canal boat. The trip begins in Kerala, a region of palm-fringed lakes, rivers and British-built canals which has had a thriving spice trade for thousands of years. They explore a boat built by a local ruler and make offerings at a temple, while Pru learns a traditional dance.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: Offred is punished by Serena Joy, which leaves her shaken and brings back painful memories of her time at the Red Centre with Moira. A complication during the ceremony makes matters worse, and threatens her very survival.(n)

programme.title: Merciless
programme.desc: The first episode of a Brazilian crime drama. A successful lawyer becomes an advisor to a powerful politician, while leading a double life as a serial killer. He uses his position to infiltrate the police task force assigned to track him down, just as an FBI agent is brought in from the US to help crack the case. In Portuguese. The full series is available on All 4.(n)

programme.title: End of Watch
programme.desc: Two Los Angeles cops make their regular patrol of the city, dealing with petty offences while one records their lives on camera for a documentary project. The officers end up in over their heads when they stumble on evidence that could bring down a drug cartel, putting them squarely in the gang's firing line. Crime thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Michael Pena.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef heads to the Seascape restaurant in the village of Islip on Long Island, New York, in a bid to change the fortunes of its owner, who is nearly $1million in debt. Gordon is dismayed to discover unprotected meat and fish left next to mouldy pesto jars in the kitchen and plans to close down the eatery until radical changes are made.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: An extended edition, inspired by and in memory of MP Jo Cox, in which hosts Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker celebrate what the nation's people have in common a year on since her murder. Guests include Nick Clegg, Jon Richardson, Stephen Mangan, Elbow, Lily Cole and James Buckley. Plus, political rivals Tony Blair and William Hague, Nicola Sturgeon and Ruth Davidson, and Michael Gove and Ed Balls take part in comedy sketches.(n)

Kirstie Allsopp meets newlyweds Chris and Amy in Cheshire, who are looking to buy their first home together and want something semi-rural in pricey areas including Knutsford, Lymm and Frodsham.(n)

programme.desc: Bubbly co-host Dr Mary joins Frasier to present a Christmas parade, but he is forced to take drastic action when she steals his limelight. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

Finally, Luke and Louise deliver a polished performance, which is let down by an over-cooked main course, before the winning couple is revealed.(n)

programme.desc: Allegations of abuse and neglect at specialist dementia care homes run by private healthcare company Bupa, with covert filming by a reporter working as an assistant at one home. Jackie Long investigates evidence of overstretched and under-resourced care staff, questionable treatment of residents and safety worries.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man arrives at Luton police station claiming his life is in danger and that he has just escaped from a slave-owning gang that held him captive at a travellers' site in a remote part of Bedfordshire. Cameras follow as a major operation is launched to investigate the allegations, with more than 200 officers drafted in for a dawn raid on the site to arrest their suspects.(n)

programme.title: Loaded

When Leon, Josh and Ewan find out what he has done they're forced to take extreme measures of their own, while Casey goes on the rampage and unleashes the full force of her fury on Leon.(n)

programme.title: Wife Swap
programme.desc: The reality show returns for a one-off edition. Pauline, Andy and 14-year-old Katie live on Canvey Island - the area with the nation's third highest `out' vote. For seven days, bar worker Pauline swaps her home, job and family with psychotherapist and Green Party councillor Kat, who lives in rural Nottinghamshire with her partner Roger and 17-year-old daughter Sophie. These strong-minded women immerse themselves in each other's lives and face issues around immigration, class and racism. But will they hear anything that changes their mind about Brexit?.(n)

programme.title: Battling the Bailiffs
programme.desc: Documentary about the campaigners on a mission to prevent people being evicted by standing up to bailiffs. The housing crisis has resulted in more than 50 families a week being evicted. Filmed over nine months, this film follows 42-year-old boxing trainer Chrissy Morris and his friends who are battling the system, spending their spare time travelling around the country and stopping the bailiffs in their tracks so that desperate families can keep a roof over their heads.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Animals Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Another compilation of comical clips, this time featuring animals in zoos, safari parks and their natural habitat, with cheeky monkeys, a goat with a grudge and a loved-up llama. A mother and daughter's trip to the safari park turns into a nightmare when they are attacked by a one-eyed emu, and a woman's holiday takes an unexpected turn when she becomes the object of affection for a frisky dolphin. Animal behaviour therapist Professor Peter Neville joins Des Clarke and Zoe Lyons to provide a little scientific background to the these animal urges.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev Salter takes drastic action to stop a vehicle he suspects has class-A drugs on board, while a nasty street fight leads to a Taser being drawn. Mark Shepherd has his work cut out when a late-night pursuit heads off-road, and the arrest of a wanted man leads to drugs and a lethal weapon being discovered.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The return of the documentary following the work of a high-speed police interception unit, this time riding along with officers of Cheshire's elite crime-fighting team, whose patch is one of the UK's most affluent areas. In the first edition, Tom tries to stop a suspected petrol thief who is not willing to pull over, Bucko and Chris meet a mouthy driver who refuses to come quietly, Mike helps to carry out a textbook tactical pursuit and containment, and Jim deals with a drunk, foul-mouthed racist who has bladder-control issues.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker. Includes 5 News Update at 5.15pm.(n)

programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: Premiere. Musical remake of the romantic drama. Abigail Breslin stars as an awkward teenager staying with her family at a holiday camp in the 1960s. She embarks on a life-changing romance with the camp's charismatic dance instructor (Colt Prattes), despite the disapproval of her parents and the condemnation of society in general. With Bruce Greenwood, Debra Messing and Billy Dee Williams. Edited for sexual content.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines, sports news and weather.(n)

programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: Premiere. Musical remake of the romantic drama. Abigail Breslin stars as an awkward teenager staying with her family at a holiday camp in the 1960s. She embarks on a life-changing romance with the camp's charismatic dance instructor (Colt Prattes), despite the disapproval of her parents and the condemnation of society in general. With Bruce Greenwood, Debra Messing and Billy Dee Williams. Edited for sexual content.(n)

programme.title: Monster-in-Law
programme.desc: An unlucky-in-love woman thinks she has finally landed on her feet when she meets the man of her dreams. However, his meddling mother proves to be an overprotective nightmare who is adamant the would-be bride is Miss Wrong and hatches a plan to drive her away. Romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jane Fonda and Michael Vartan.(n)

programme.title: That's So
programme.desc: A look back at 1982, featuring news, pop and TV archive clips. It was a year that saw the Falklands War, the birth of Prince William, Channel 4's launch together with the first episode of Countdown, and Steven Spielberg's ET: The Extra-Terrestrial break box office records. It was also the age of new romanticism and electropop, while tracks such as Come on Eileen, Eye of the Tiger and Pass the Dutchie stormed the charts.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Most Shocking Reality Moments
programme.desc: A celebration of the nation's long-running love affair with reality TV, showcasing the 50 most memorable moments from some of the best-loved shows such as TOWIE, Jersey Shore and Made in Chelsea. The bumper countdown includes the time George Galloway came over all feline on Celebrity Big Brother, Gillian McKeith's dramatic fainting episodes on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, and Bobby Davro's belly flop on The Games. Featuring contributions by Calum Best, Charlotte Crosby, Amy Childs, Paul Danan, Janice Dickinson, Dane Bowers and Vanessa Feltz.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Adulthood
programme.desc: Sam Peel returns to his old neighbourhood after serving six years in prison for manslaughter, keen to put his violent past behind him. He is soon confronted with the consequences of his actions, including death threats against his family motivated by revenge for the man he killed. Drama sequel to Kidulthood, directed by and starring Noel Clarke. With Adam Deacon and Scarlett Alice Johnson.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property guru Ann Maurice applies her home improvement remedies to a house in Spennymoor, Co Durham, for the purpose of finding an eager buyer as soon as possible.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Angels of Jarm
programme.desc: The children grow tomato plants, and Rafe gives gardening advice to Ephraim.(n)

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Marsha's picnic blanket is damaged and she believes Cici is to blame.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Stubborn and Mr Fussy go to the beach, while Mr Messy and Mr Noisy upset Mr Quiet's lunch.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: The rabbit is helping Lee and Sioux look for acorns in heaps of fallen leaves, when a chimpanzee named Wookey turns up and joins in.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: A power cut leaves the house in darkness, so Peppa and George have fun looking for a torch and thinking of games to play.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: I Don't Want to Go to Bed.
programme.desc: The youngster decides she is not ready for bed and wants to stay up late.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Alex works toward getting his Action Scouts fire safety badge, so Marshall and the Paw Patrol go camping with him and Mr Porter to show him how to make and extinguish a camp fire.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The team finishes building a new milkshake bar, and the job inspires Scoop to experiment with ingredients for concrete.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Tom and Trevor compete, hoping to be crowned the barbecue champion - but disaster strikes when a tree is accidentally set on fire.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Diesel tries to impress the island's youngsters by swapping his cargo of slate for a haul of shiny red apples.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Zac wishes for a pet ziffilon for Kaz, but the lovable blue bird is a lot, lot bigger than either of them expected.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Broken Toy Wash.
programme.desc: Fuse is upset because his new toy wash has been broken and Noddy uses his investigating skills to find out who the culprit is.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Cap'n Turbot finds a giant dinosaur bone, but a landslide leaves him trapped on a small cliff ledge.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: A mole causes problems at King Thistle's golf course, so a gnome is hired to drive it away.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Fizzy offers to deliver a picture to Digby, but it ends up covered in mud.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa get caught outside in the middle of a big thunderstorm.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Fern the Arctic fox has lost the rest of her pack, so Wissper asks Gertie the giraffe and Otis the oxpecker bird to see if their extra height can help with the search.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The little rabbit and Alien hear that the moon is made of cheese, so they set off in Alien's rocket to find some for Daddy rabbit's cauliflower cheese.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Matthew Wright is joined by a panel of guests and the studio audience to debate the issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Tracy Metro tries to freshen up a Leicestershire home, where peeling wallpaper has left owners Mark and Pascaline unable to sell their property.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Patrick is devastated by what he has done and his lack of recollection of it, while Brian blames Justin for Ava's accident. VJ considers giving Luc up for good.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Xanthe sets out on a secret mission, Terese seeks support for her worrying discovery by requesting an appointment with Karl, while the Robinson clan faces a day of big change.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part one of two. Hetty dispatches the team to recover a book containing top-secret information, which has been stolen from the personal effects of a murdered antiques dealer. Starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Fatal Performance
programme.desc: An aspiring actress, working as a waitress, is offered a lucrative contract to impersonate the wife of a businessman during a prestigious reception event in their home. However, she soon learns the devious truth behind the proposal and what seemed like a simple job soon turns into a nightmare scenario. Thriller, starring Nicholle Tom and David Palffy. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Xanthe sets out on a secret mission, Terese seeks support for her worrying discovery by requesting an appointment with Karl, while the Robinson clan faces a day of big change.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Patrick is devastated by what he has done and his lack of recollection of it, while Brian blames Justin for Ava's accident. VJ considers giving Luc up for good.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Car Crash TV
programme.desc: New series. Return of the programme showcasing events caught on film by dashboard-mounted cameras, from freak accidents and amazing escapes to racehorses on the loose.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sean uses a manual battering ram on a raid on a drug dealer's house, while Jim's pursuit of a speeding driver leads to some narcotic-related discoveries and there is a high-speed chase through the streets of Macclesfield. Jenno gets a faceful of pepper spray, Jim has to deal with a mouthy drink driver, and Tom hunts down a violent armed robber. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Murder of April Jones: 5 Years On
programme.desc: Documentary examining the events surrounding the murder of the 5-year-old girl in 2012 and looking at how those closest to her are still fighting to prevent such a tragedy happening again. Featuring interviews with April's mother and sister, as well as the friends and neighbours who searched in vain for her, while charting the movements of her killer Mark Bridger in the build-up to his crime, and the repercussions for the community.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal has the latest developments and invites his studio audience and celebrity guests to discuss how the Big Brother housemates are getting on.(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Gubagude Ko
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's scorching drama of a young dealer seduced by money and power, who hooks up with a high-powered company trader. Michael Douglas won an Oscar for his performance as stockbroking devil Gordon Gekko(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Twenty-two years after Jurassic Park opened on Isla Nubar, a dinosaur-themed resort attracts thousands of visitors each year, just as John Hammond envisioned. However, following a bad sag in turnout a new effort is undertaken to revitalize Jurassic World, but once again mankind's attempts to interfere with nature bring ominous results(n)

programme.title: Black Salt
programme.desc: An Interpol agent undertakes a mission to recover a deadly weapon of mass destruction(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: (2008) Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy and Morgan Freeman star in this violent action adventure from Russian director Timur Bekmambetov (Nightwatch, Daywatch). The life of office worker Wesley Gibson (McAvoy) has been one of frustration, disappointment and anxiety; he has an overbearing boss, his girlfriend and his best friend are duplicitously having an affair, and he's on medication to calm his nerves. To top it all, he one day finds himself on the wrong end of an assassination attempt. Luckily, the agile, honed and lethal Fox (Jolie) is at hand to save his life. However, she also reveals that his recently deceased father was secretly a supremely skilled killer, and that it's her job to ensure that Wesley takes his place in the Fraternity, the mystical organisation overseen by Sloan (Freeman), which exists to rid the world of evil-doers. And so begins Wesley's journey to unlock his hitherto unsuspected innate deadly abilities and use them for good. The cinematography echoes the inventiveness of Bekmambetov's earlier movies and takes a Matrix-like delight in playing with the tempo and camera angles of the fight scenes(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Hardboiled detective Max Payne obsessively hunts the murderer who killed his wife and child(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Docudrama about the true story of the Deepwater Horizon disaster, which resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in US history. The film depicts the challenges the oil rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Soldier George Clooney leads a rogue squad including Mark Wahlberg and Ice Cube on a journey to find hidden Iraqi gold(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between an aspiring cop and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) as they pursue a Miami drug lord together with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Hard-nosed army sergeant Tom Highway battles rebellious recruits and his own strait-laced superiors in the build-up to America's invasion of Grenada. Action comedy(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: A mysterious wanderer looks for dry land after Earth is engulfed by water(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Doctor Detroit
programme.desc: Comedy starring Dan Aykroyd as a well-meaning college professor who finds himself unintentionally entangled with hookers and the local mafia(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: In this dark comedy, a group of retirees wants to save their homes -- but they're not typical senior citizens trying to make the most of their Social Security checks. Four aging former mobsters -- Joey "Bats" Pistella (Burt Reynolds), Bobby Bartellemeo (Richard Dreyfuss), Mike the Brick (Dan Hedaya), and Tony "The Mouth" Donato (Seymour Cassel) -- live in the same rundown Miami apartment complex, the Raj Mahal. New owners hope to clear out the current tenants and replace them with a younger, more lucrative clientele. But the veteran gangsters don't want to move, so to scrape up the extra rent money, they take a job executing the father of a Miami mob boss. They happen to know he's already dead, so all they have to do is make it look like they did the hit. Their problems start when loudmouthed ladies' man Tony tells too much to Ferris (Jennifer Tilly), a stripper, and soon she's talked him into murdering her mother (Lainie Kazan) in exchange for her silence. The Crew also features Carrie-Anne Moss as a detective and Jeremy Piven as a mob kingpin out to avenge his father's death(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: Consenting Adults
programme.desc: A wealthy couple befriend their new neighbours, but do the newcomers have ulterior motives for their friendship? Thriller(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: Remake of the Japanese horror hit about a strange videotape. Whoever watches it is told they have seven days to live. A reporter tracks down the tape and has a week to solve the mystery(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: Novelist William Peter Blatty based his best-seller on the last known Catholic-sanctioned exorcism in the United States. Blatty transformed the little boy in the 1949 incident into a little girl named Regan, played by 14-year-old Linda Blair. Suddenly prone to fits and bizarre behavior, Regan proves quite a handful for her actress-mother, Chris MacNeil (played by Ellen Burstyn, although Blatty reportedly based the character on his next-door neighbor Shirley MacLaine). When Regan gets completely out of hand, Chris calls in young priest Father Karras (Jason Miller), who becomes convinced that the girl is possessed by the Devil and that they must call in an exorcist: namely, Father Merrin (Max von Sydow). His foe proves to be no run-of-the-mill demon, and both the priest and the girl suffer numerous horrors during their struggles. The Exorcist received a theatrical rerelease in 2000, in a special edition that added 11 minutes of footage trimmed from the film's original release and digitally enhanced Chris Newman's Oscar-winning sound work(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Agnes is running away from her ex boyfriend with her new boyfriend Peter. Peter is also on the run from the military - and bugs that he believes is going to take over his body. Together they seek shelter at a small motel. Soon Agnes also sees the bugs' crawling up from every corner witch is the start for a joint battle against the bugs. Slowly paranoia and fear takes over and threatens to destroy them both mentally and physically(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this feature-film adaptation of the popular fantasy video-game series. After realizing that their home is becoming uninhabitable, a race of orcs travel to the land of Azeroth. There, they encounter the realm's human denizens, who fight back against the invaders. In time, an orc warrior (Toby Kebbell) forges an alliance with a group of humans in order to overthrow his race's corrupt leader (Daniel Wu) and bring peace to the land. Directed by Duncan Jones (Moon), the film co-stars Paula Patton (Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol), Ben Foster (3:10 to Yuma), Dominic Cooper (The Devil's Double), Ruth Negga (World War Z), and Travis Fimmel (Vikings)(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: Picked to lead the first US troops into Vietnam, Lt Col Hal Moore drills his boys in preparation for battle. But Moore isn't just a soldier: he is a son, a husband and a father. And each of the men under his command bring their own fears and families to the battle. A moving wartime actioner(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Soured on dating, a conservative blogger (Erica Tazel) has sworn off men, until she meets the man of her dreams (Columbus Short) by chance. However, she discovers that this "chance" meeting was actually arranged by her best friend through a discreet dating service in this romantic comedy(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

The Exorcist received a theatrical rerelease in 2000, in a special edition that added 11 minutes of footage trimmed from the film's original release and digitally enhanced Chris Newman's Oscar-winning sound work(n)

programme.title: Bug

programme.title: Warcraft

After realizing that their home is becoming uninhabitable, a race of orcs travel to the land of Azeroth. There, they encounter the realm's human denizens, who fight back against the invaders. In time, an orc warrior (Toby Kebbell) forges an alliance with a group of humans in order to overthrow his race's corrupt leader (Daniel Wu) and bring peace to the land. Directed by Duncan Jones (Moon), the film co-stars Paula Patton (Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol), Ben Foster (3:10 to Yuma), Dominic Cooper (The Devil's Double), Ruth Negga (World War Z), and Travis Fimmel (Vikings)(n)

He tries using the professor's latest invention that can see through metal, but he ends up swallowing a golden bottle cap and winning the contest. The crew gets to go on a tour of the Slurm factory and party with Slurms McKenzie, the party slug mascot who is sick and tired of constantly partying. Fry gets thirsty on the tour and falls into the Slurm river, so Leela and Bender try to save him. They all go down a drain and discover that Slurm is really made from the secretions of a giant queen slug. They are captured, but Slurms saves them. He and his assistant, Kif Kroker, become homeless vagrants, so Professor Farnsworth hires them to work for Planet Express. While delivering pillows to a high-gravity planet, Zapp convinces Fry and Bender to overthrow Leela so that he can be captain. programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Cops on Trial. A&E explores what happens when the protectors become the enemy in American Justice: Cops on Trial. Brought to light by the memorable Rodney King beating, police brutality has become a hot issue. It has even affected working conditions. The Los Angeles police department hardly has enough staff to work the streets due to a drop in enrollment and support. That condition is not surprising given the far-reaching amount of corruption in the system. Ex-police chief Daryl Gates remembers the King incident and the subsequent fall in popularity. Also recalled is the exposure of New York police corruption in all its forms. Frank Serpico investigated the toughest units and found a deep misuse of power. Legal experts explore the best way to prosecute wayward soldiers in this one-hour program(n)

programme.title: Emma

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben persuades Bonnie and Ray to invite his conservative Aunt Betty to Emma's baptism in the hope she will give the baby a generous gift, but this means hiding Ray's sexuality from her. Meanwhile, Riley makes Tucker and Danny compete to be chosen as the godfather.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted and Barney decide to adopt a child together when they become fed up with women during Thanksgiving. However, they soon spiral into couple-like behaviour and have an argument. Elsewhere, Marshall and Lily agree to move to the suburbs.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin pays a visit to the doctor, hoping to confirm whether she is actually pregnant, but does not receive the test results she expected and tries to keep the news from her friends. Meanwhile, Marshall is determined to dazzle his neighbourhood with a spectacular set of Christmas lights, and enlists a local lad to help set up his display. However, he remains unaware the youngster has an ulterior motive.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: When a new bar opens in the neighbourhood, it becomes the final piece of the puzzle for Nick's epic Valentine's Day pub crawl. Jess and Ryan drunkenly contemplate their future, Coach meets a new woman - several times over - and Schmidt tries to fit into the world of politics.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess takes a bumpy stroll down memory lane when she and the gang travel to her childhood home in Portland, Oregon, for her father's wedding. With Ryan back in England, everyone is worried that his relationship with Jess is nearing its end, but she is determined to make it work. Jamie Lee Curtis and Rob Reiner guest star.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Santiago's ongoing bet about who can make the most arrests comes to an embarrassing conclusion, while Boyle receives a medal following the shooting, but his pain medication loosens his tongue and he starts to reveal what he really thinks of his colleagues.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: For his first task back in the field, Jeffords prepares to join Peralta and Boyle on a mission to infiltrate a gym where steroids are being sold illegally, but Peralta begins to have second thoughts about whether the sergeant is ready. Meanwhile, Santiago and Diaz try to determine who has burgled Gina's flat.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj organise a stag party for Howard, but stories about his sexual history are unwittingly revealed, and he has to persuade bride-to-be Bernadette not to call off the wedding. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin becomes suspicious of Barney's relationship with Patrice, questioning whether he is going through an emotional crisis, and attempts to split them up. Meanwhile, Marshall is shocked to discover his mother has started a new romantic chapter in her life with an unexpected partner.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ted invites his old university professor, who told him he would never make it as an architect, to the grand opening of the GNB building. However, when the academic snubs him saying he does not know who he is, Ted goes back to the campus to confront him, taking the gang along for the ride. While there, Lily and Marshall run into an old acquaintance they would rather have avoided. Guest starring Seth Green and Peter Gallagher.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: With Jess away on jury duty, Nick rents out the loft to help pay for Schmidt's stag night. Winston suspects KC is cheating on him, so asks CeCe to help him find proof. Comedy, starring Jake Johnson and Max Greenfield.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: A new new girl enters the gang's life when a beautiful pharmaceutical rep sub-lets Jess's room while she is on jury duty - and she quickly makes an impression. Megan Fox guests.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Max and Caroline are approached by a TV producer who would like to shoot scenes from an upcoming episode of a popular reality show in front of the serving window of their cupcake business. Guest starring Kim Kardashian West, with Kat Dennings and Beth Behrs.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Caroline accidentally loses Han's expensive pet fish when she cleans out its tank, so Max suggests selling a sentimental gift to pay for a replacement. Meanwhile, Oleg and Sophie attempt to split up with their casual dates so they can resume an exclusive relationship together. Comedy, starring Kat Dennings and Beth Behrs.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldon's post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pair's friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Marnie receives some news about the Nightingales, Zack is tricked again, and Tegan and Misbah have a stressful encounter. Meanwhile, Neeta catches Lily taking photos of the exam papers and threatens to report it.(n)

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre's plans for a baby shower are put on hold when Rainbow seeks medical advice about a headache and discovers that there are complications with her pregnancy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Sheldon have an argument over their bathroom schedules, so Penny and Leonard intervene. Meanwhile, Howard and Bernadette cancel their holiday plans when she feels unwell.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny discovers she has a dedicated group of fans from her Serial Ape-ist days when she accompanies Leonard to a comic-con. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Amy host a brunch at Penny's flat, and stress over the baby's arrival prompts Howard to make an impulsive purchase.(n)

programme.title: Vlogglebox
programme.desc: New series. Programme in which 16 to 24-year-olds give their opinions on popular viral content that young people are watching and sharing on their phones, laptops and tablets. The first edition features reactions to Ed Sheeran doing Carpool Karaoke, fidget spinner tricks, Socialism Strikes Back!, I Luv It by Psy, and a bad night for Theresa May.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers
programme.desc: The crew revamps more of the nation's most embarrassing, offensive and sometimes downright awful body art. Luke's drunken tattoo got him into bother at home, while Mark's inking of Buddha on his stomach has left him a laughing stock.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will is unhappy about being forced by Mr Gilbert to take a work experience job at a garage due to a mix-up that sees Neil joining a newspaper. Meanwhile, Jay sorts out a placement for himself and Simon at his father's plant hire company. Starring Simon Bird and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will plans to celebrate his birthday with a grown-up dinner, but his friends face a dilemma when they discover the event clashes with a more popular party. They end up gatecrashing the rival gathering, only to find that Simon's French exchange student steals the limelight.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Roughly once every 40 years in the northern Kalahari Desert of Botswana an ancient waterway called the Savute channel fills and flows into the surrounding marshes. This attracts thousands of grazing animals from across the region - and also draws predators to the area. This documentary follows the fortunes of Africa's largest herd of elephants and a pride of seven lions as they come face to face in an epic fight for survival, with drought having weakened the elephants and the lions desperately hungry. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton, her husband Frank Pope and their three young children move to the Samburu National Reserve in Kenya, where she is taking over the running of a safari camp. Things get off to a rocky start when guests arrive earlier than expected and an elephant emergency pushes everyone to their limits. Has the family got what it takes to survive their new life? Julian Rhind-Tutt narrates.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The family is settling into their new life running a safari camp and protecting elephants in northern Kenya's remote Samburu National Reserve. Guests have arrived and are expecting a luxury wildlife experience, but Saba is soon called away to rescue an injured crocodile.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Return of the Giant Killers: Africa's Lion Kings.
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting the pride of African lions featured in Africa's Giant Killers: Natural World, which detailed a clash between drought-weakened elephants and hungry big cats in the northern stretches of the Kalahari Desert in Botswana. This follow-up rejoins the pride at the start of the rainy season, when the departure of the elephants brings a whole host of new problems for the lions. The males begin to turn against each other, and one inexperienced lioness places her cubs in mortal danger as a rival group challenges the area's resident lions. Wild fires caused by lightning devastate the landscape, and as the dust begins to settle, the pride must once again face off with the elephants or risk starvation. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

Alessandro Gassman, Amber Valletta, Kate Nauta, Matthew Modine. Directed by Louis Leterrier(n)

programme.title: Blue Jasmine
programme.desc: In this quirky, intimate comedy-drama, a haughty New York woman's life falls apart after she gets divorced from her wealthy husband, prompting her to move in with her sister in San Francisco. In time, she must learn to take care of herself while in a haze of antidepressants(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther 2
programme.desc: The bumbling Inspector Jacques Clouseau searches for a thief who is stealing treasures from around the world, including the priceless Pink Panther diamond(n)

programme.title: Son of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau's illegitimate son (Roberto Benigni) stumbles onto the case of a kidnapped princess. Dreyfus: Herbert Lom. Maria: Claudia Cardinale. Princess Yasmin: Deborah Farentino. Yussa: Jennifer Edwards. Hans: Robert Davi. Lazar: Anton Rodgers. Cato: Burt Kwouk. Directed and co-scripted by Blake Edwards(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: The last Pink Panther film to star Peter Sellers before his untimely death. French mobster Philippe Douvier, suffering from a lack of respect in the crime community, orders the murder of Chief Inspector Clouseau, who has been hailed as a genius. After the assassination attempt, a dead body is found in Clouseau's car and everyone - including Clouseau's former superior, Charles Dreyfus - believes Clouseau is dead. Feeling much better, Dreyfus is released from the mental hospital that Clouseau drove him to in the first place. But Clouseau is not dead and goes undercover together with his trusty manservant Cato to discover who tried to kill him(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: A lazy stoner is the sole witness to a murder by an evil drug lord and a corrupt cop. Marked for death, he runs for his life, dragging his dazed dealer and his supplier with him on a hilarious pot-fueled adventure(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: Thomas Crown was born poor but made his way through Oxford on a boxing scholarship. With his sharp sense for business and ruthless ambition, Crown has become a self-made billionaire. Despite his wealth and power, he still seeks new challenges, and he steals art not for the profits but for the sheer excitement. However, as fun as art theft might be, it's still illegal, and investigator Catherine Banning is brought in to track down the culprit(n)

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Craig Schwartz is a puppeteer at the end of his string, who takes a job as an office assistant and discovers a small boarded-up door which leads directly into the head of John Malkovich. And that is just the start of the weirdness(n)

programme.title: Power
programme.desc: Call Me James. Season 3 begins with Ghost out of the drug game, and Angela having to decide between love and honor. Also, Tasha is reeling from Shawn's death, and Tommy feels compelled to make some adventurous moves(n)

programme.title: Power
programme.desc: It's Never Over. Ghost deals with loose ends before tangling with some new nightlife competition; Tommy confronts Tasha, who must learn to coexist with Angela. Later, Tommy finds an advisor in a former lover(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Artifact hunter and archaeologist extraordinaire Ben Franklin Gates learns of his own family's implication in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln by John Wilkes Booth. Gates must then locate an elusive diary, not only to clear his family's name, but to unearth and connect several secrets, buried within the book, that point to a massive, global conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Harley Davidson & The Marlboro Man
programme.desc: A Hog-riding drifter and a retired rodeo rider team up and plan a bank robbery to help an old friend whose Rock 'n' Roll grill is about to be seized by some less than accommodating creditors(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: In this documentary centered on legendary filmmaker John Ford's cinematic contributions to Allied morale during World War II, actor/musician Kris Kristofferson narrates as the How Green Was My Valley director turns his back on Tinseltown in order to fulfill his patriotic duty. By the time the United States became involved in World War II, John Ford was already a film legend, but when Uncle Sam came calling the veteran filmmaker eagerly packed his bags and set his sites on the frontlines. Though Ford did sustain battlefield injuries during the production of the Oscar-winning documentary The Battle of Midway, the remarkable film endeared him to patriotic American audiences across the country and his next wartime effort, 1943's December 7th, proceeded to earn the filmmaker yet another Oscar. In addition to featuring footage from these and other, lesser-known wartime films from Ford, this documentary also offers an intimate look at the complex filmmaker and explores his remarkable legacy through both archive footage and interviews with such notable directors as Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich(n)

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: An expectant couple are sentenced to a high-tech prison in a futuristic society where population growth is state-controlled(n)

programme.title: Company Business
programme.desc: It's nonstop action and suspense as two spies - one American, one Soviet - form an unlikely alliance when the CIA and KGB unite to assassinate them(n)

After the pair escape, Samir becomes involved in organising a series of devastating terror attacks. When he is spotted in the vicinity of the bombings, FBI agent Roy Clayton is charged with tracking Horn down before he strikes again(n)

programme.title: Face Off

programme.title: The Dogs of War
programme.desc: An American mercenary scouts an African country on a mission to overthrow its unstable government. But the suspicious government has him thrown in jail, where, between torture sessions, he meets an imprisoned dissident leader who teaches him about the country's struggles(n)

programme.desc: In a black and white future, an unconventional policeman is searching for a missing geneticist, aided by the wayward woman's beautiful younger sister. Dark animation about powerful corporations and endemic corruption(n)

programme.title: Hancock
programme.desc: A hard-drinking lush finds himself thrust into superhero mode in director Peter Berg's unconventional look at the private life of a crime-fighter. Will Smith stars as the embittered do-gooder whose lifestyle is more akin to a rock star than a role model, and who has grown as disillusioned with his once-admiring public as they have of him(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: Medieval fantasy meets futuristic science fiction in this effects-heavy action epic from former X-Files director Rob Bowman. In present-day London, 12-year-old Quinn Abercromby witnesses the awakening of a hibernating dragon from a centuries-long slumber, the result of a construction dig supervised by his mother and an incident for which Quinn feels partially responsible. Twenty years later, the adult Quinn is the fire chief of a refortified castle community, responsible for dousing the blazes lit by the dragon's prodigious number of flame-spewing offspring, airborne juggernauts that have wreaked havoc across the globe, torching civilization and turning humans into an endangered species. Hope arrives in the form of Denton "Dragon Slayer" Van Zan, an American known to be the only man to ever kill one of the dragons, and Alex Jenson, a scientist/pilot who's a member of Van Zan's army, a zealous fighting force that includes a secret weapon: the Archangels, paratroopers using themselves as bait to attract and then dispatch the deadly beasts(n)

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: Story about a serial killer who agrees to be a bone-marrow donor for the dying son of a cop in order to escape from jail(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The driver of a Ferrari is gunned down by a motorcyclist and the victim is identified as petty officer Colin Boxer, who was holding down a second job as a valet parker and had borrowed the sports car. The owner of the vehicle turns out to be Vijay Chaya, the billionaire head of a large corporation, and the team suspects a case of mistaken identity. During the course of the investigation, Gibbs chances on a medal awarded to Leroy Jethro Moore, the man he was named after and an estranged friend of his father. Guest starring Billy Dee Williams (The Empire Strikes Back) and Ralph Waite (The Waltons).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. First lieutenant Michael Torres gets involved in a fight before falling to the ground, and is found beaten to death the next morning. The only witness is his friend and colleague Captain Joe Westcott, who suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder and has trouble distinguishing reality from his past military experiences in the Middle East.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tony reviews satellite footage of rebel forces in the Middle East and spots Kersey among a group of insurgents, concluding that Joe Westcott's fear of him was well-founded. Back at HQ, Abby creates a 3D computer model of the attack that occurred in Afghanistan and Joe dons a virtual-reality headset to relive the traumatic events. Will it jog his memory?.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Teenager Lydia Wade manages to escape a gang of masked men trying to abduct her and her friend Rosie, the daughter of a US Navy commander. Lydia's Navy captain father David Wade was shot dead during the attack and her mother is overseas, so Ziva offers to look after the girl, while Abby tries to jog her memory by creating facial reconstructions of the attackers based on some grainy CCTV footage. DiNozzo and McGee find links on Rosie's laptop to possible suspect John `Diesel' Stevens.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is called to the scene when there is an attempt on the life of FBI agent TC Fornell, with the assailant identified as Navy seaman Tyler Brown. The pair team up and visit the bar where Brown worked and bump into their mutual ex-wife Diane Sterling, who was operating undercover as an employee suspected of stealing customers' identities. Joe Spano and Melinda McGraw guest star.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is unsure of his future with the California Bureau of Investigation following his confrontation with serial killer Red John. Police chief Gale Bertram calls on the consultant's help when a prominent lawyer and Statehouse lobbyist is kidnapped, but finds him reluctant to join the investigation. Crime drama, guest starring Michael Gaston (Jericho), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is forced to help his estranged brother-in-law, who has become embroiled in a murder investigation. Despite his reservations, the consultant joins the case, but is forced to face his dubious past and encounters a number of old acquaintances. Crime drama, guest starring Kevin Rankin (Bionic Woman), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A murder case leads Jane into conflict with charismatic cult leader Bret Stiles, whom he first met while investigating the death of a media mogul. The consultant is surprised when his antagonist offers him information regarding the identity of serial killer Red John, and the location of missing psychic Kristina Frye. Guest starring Malcolm McDowell (Heroes), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A man convicted of murder and rape is released from jail because of faulty DNA evidence and subsequently killed, prompting Jane and the team to investigate his death. However, it soon becomes apparent that more than one person wanted revenge on him. Guest starring Jack Coleman (Heroes), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The case of a murdered jockey leads Jane and the team into the murky underworld of horse racing, where they uncover a number of suspects. Crime drama, guest starring Jim Beaver (Deadwood) and Olesya Rulin (High School Musical), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The Trial Analysis team heads to Miami with JP Nunnelly to work on a drug trafficking case in which both their clients and the jurors' lives are in jeopardy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Delilah is rushed to hospital when the stress of planning her wedding becomes too much for her. Meanwhile, the team investigates the unexplained death of a healthy petty officer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs, McGee and Torres travel to a remote area of Paraguay controlled by violent rebels, in search of a Navy Seal who disappeared during an unsanctioned trip. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Ashe and Preston try to narrow their focus to reliable lines of inquiry in both cases, first visiting Jesse Carr's old college campus, then embarking on a dangerous manhunt.(n)

programme.desc: Brian begins a new career as an estate agent after having cosmetic surgery, which gets him in trouble with Quagmire after encouraging his friend to buy a new property.(n)

programme.desc: A car salesman gets the better of Stan in a transaction, making him realise he has lost his negotiation and interrogation skills. programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan sets his heart on speaking at the Republican Party's national convention on behalf of the CIA, but a colleague is chosen ahead of him. Not to be denied, he accepts the endorsement of the Gay Republicans chapter instead - and is surprised to find his decision causes controversy.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois books a couple's vacation, but it turns out to be a marriage counselling programme. Carter is frustrated because the kids are so into their electronics, and tries to force them into playing the old-fashioned way.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan becomes a drag racer in an effort to satisfy Francine's desire for more excitement in their marriage. programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan and Francine try for another baby, while Roger decides to enrol at the same college as Hayley in a bid to experience student life - but somehow ends up teaching a class. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Wendy Schaal.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The residents of Quahog are invited to spend an evening at James Woods' mansion, but guests start turning up dead, transforming the event into a murder mystery, with everyone struggling to identify the killer among them.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine discovers Stan's love of figure-skating and decides to take it up so they can perform as a pair. However, his competitive nature leads him to look for a more able partner. Meanwhile, Steve's classmate brings his mail-order bride to school.(n)

Convinced she was murdered, Jane searches for the body and concludes the victim was placed in her relative's coffin - prompting him to test his theory on the day of the funeral. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.desc: Jane and the team investigate a death threat, but find themselves in danger when a building explodes. Meanwhile, Lisbon confronts billionaire Walter Mashburn again when they meet during a case. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.desc: The Leverage team goes after a global aviation executive and as part of their con they must convince him that they can lay their hands on Howard Hughes's vintage aircraft, `The Spruce Goose'. Starring Timothy Hutton, Christian Kane and Gina Bellman.(n)

programme.desc: A hockey player's son asks the con-artists to protect his father from being killed on the rink. However, they quickly discover that the outfit's unscrupulous owner is planning to turn his back on the side and declare bankruptcy - and that he is paying opposing teams to injure his own players so he does not have to pay them bonuses.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Returning from a six-month posting in the Gulf, Navy lieutenant commander Megan Huffner opens her front door to find her husband Noel dead in his chair. Gibbs and the team investigate and find the victim died three or four weeks earlier, and an unusual $100 bill in his wallet proves to be a vital clue. Meanwhile, Tony's father visits for Christmas and looks to rebuild their fractured relationship. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Artie's traditional ideas go toe-to-toe with the kids' (and their parents') cutting-edge, multitasking ways, but this modern family comes to learn that love, understanding, and an openness to trying new and old things, will always keep a family together. Andy Fickman directs from a script by Lisa Addario and Joe Syracuse(n)

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: A workaholic architect, frustrated in his job but determined to make a better life for his family, is bestowed with a powerful universal remote that allows him more control over his life than he ever knew possible in director Frank Coraci's high-concept fantasy comedy. On the surface, Michael Newman (Adam Sandler) seems to have it all, yet with all the demands forced upon him by his ungrateful boss (David Hasselhoff), Michael finds that setting aside time to spend with his loving wife, Donna (Kate Beckinsale), and two picture-perfect children, Ben (Joseph Castanon) and Samantha (Tatum McCann), has grown increasingly difficult. When a frustrating bout with the television remote leads the overworked husband and father to a nearby Bed, Bath & Beyond in search of a universal remote with the power to control all of his electronic devices, a curious peek into the back room leads Michael into the company of eccentric employee and talented inventor Morty (Christopher Walken). It seems that Morty has created a device that will not only allow Michael complete control over his television and stereo, but his entire life as well. As Michael discovers that the remarkable device has the power to muffle the barks of the family dog, zoom himself past an irritating quarrel with his wife, and even allow him to travel back and forth through time to different points in his life, the rush of being able to skip straight to the good parts in life soon leaves him feeling as if he's missing out on the total experience. Only when Michael begins to realize that the he has lost control of his life and the remote is now programming him does he finally learn that life is as much about the moments he'd rather forget as it is the moments he will always remember(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lost Our Lisa. Lisa Simpson (voice of Yeardley Smith) has been looking forward to seeing a special exhibit of rare Egyptian lore at the Springtonian Museum called "the Treasures of Isis," and her mother Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) promises to take her on the show's final day. However, Marge's plans change when Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) comes home with various items from "Yuk-ingham Palace," the neighborhood novelty shop, super-glued to his face and she has to take him to the doctor. While Marge insists Lisa must stay home, Lisa tricks her easily misled father Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) into giving his permission for her to take the bus to the museum. But Lisa misreads the schedule and ends up on the outskirts of Springfield, and she flies into a panic when she ends up in the city's Russian district. When Homer and Marge realize Lisa is lost, Homer leaps into action to find her, though his actions make a difficult situation all the more complicated. "Lost Our Lisa" was first aired on May 10, 1998(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares breakfast food, including omelette and banana bran muffins.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten celebrates Halloween by creating food with an orange theme.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares chicken piccatta with buttermilk mash.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef shares aromatic dishes, showcasing herbs and spices as she creates a spicy pulled pork stew.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates her favourite French recipes including Herbes de Provence grilled chicken which uses a touch of lavender.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Can Ezra and Julie help Judi Parsons reduce her menu and get her back on the ice with her fishing friends.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond whips up chocolate treats, including white chocolate raspberry cheesecake, dipped and decorated waffle cones, milk chocolate mousse, and a chocolate orange martini.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a picnic for the younger kids, including animal crackers, cereal chicken fingers, cucumber finger sandwiches, salad on a stick, and mini watermelon wedges.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares three comforting make-ahead meals - chicken cordon bleu casserole, Tex-Mex tamale pie with a spicy beef filling, and a large pan of bean and bacon soup.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree and her daughter Paige reminisce over an afternoon tea for two, as they enjoy ham and leak mini quiches, garden spread finger sandwiches and lemon raspberry tarts.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe embark on the second day of their culinary road trip. They reach Trawden in Lancashire and pull up beside the ruins of Wycoller Hall with one of their prize cheesecakes to compete in a garden show against some of the best local bakers. Along the way, they catch up with butcher Joseph Mellin to sample a delicacy.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe travel to Kirkby Lonsdale, Cumbria, where they enter the `dessert in a wine glass' category at the Lunesdale Country Show. They also meet gamekeeper Richard Wolfenden, who attends to the red grouse on Fourstones Moor, and he provides them with the luxury ingredient of freshly caught game.(n)

programme.title: Tia Mowry At Home
programme.desc: Tia Mowry makes a healthy green juice and a Greek breakfast frittata, and ends the day with asparagus-wrapped beef fillet to share with a friend.(n)

programme.title: Tia Mowry At Home
programme.desc: Tia Mowry invites a new friend, Catherine McCord, over for one of her favourite home-cooked meals so they can get to know each other better.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul visits San Francisco, home to one of America's most iconic bakes, the sourdough, where he creates savoury bread and butter pudding, and cheese and olive bread.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond throws a `welcome home' dinner for some friends moving back to her town. She prepares peppercorn roasted beef tenderloin with fabulous roasted garlic mash.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a picnic for the family and cowboys working with the spring calves. This hearty meal includes spicy roasted chicken legs and classic cowboy bacon and beans.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe travel to Eden Valley in Cumbria to prepare the perfect sausage roll for the Brough Annual Agricultural Show. They also meet up with Dianne Halliday from the Country Fare Bakery, where a 12-strong team produces thousands of cakes that are sold nationally and internationally.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe conclude their culinary road trip in the village of Muker in the Yorkshire Dales, where they try to impress judge Val Punchard by being creative with two items from a Dales kitchen. During their visit they meet a couple who are renowned as one of the community's finest food producers and are hoping to impress with a whisky and ginger wine cake.(n)

programme.title: Kids Baking Championship
programme.desc: To celebrate candy in all its glory, the five remaining young bakers must use three types of candy in a dessert.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul explores an area previously unknown to him, Norwegian baking. He meets a family who bake national treats and creates his version of two of Bergen's favourite bakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking heads to The Barbecue Exchange for two sandwiches - one is called Heaven and the other Hell, both packed with pulled pork and bacon.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking's eats at some of the country's best suppliers of cured, smoked and aged pork.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Swedish capital, where he tries reindeer heart at an old indoor market and catches a boat to pick wild mushrooms and blueberries on one of the city's surrounding islands. He also tries fermented herring, heads to the royal palace to check the guards' menu, and prepares gravadlax, blueberry buns, creamy mushrooms, pike perch and roasted beetroot salad.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel discovers a restaurant with undisciplined staff that treat a restaurant like their living room and drive customers away with their rude and inappropriate behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Colombo's Italian Steakhouse in Eagle Rock contacts Charles for help when a lack of harmony among his employees threatens his restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: While recovering in Brazil from a paragliding accident that almost killed him, Kevin, owner of Gauchos Village in Glendale notices a discrepancy in revenue and inventory at his restaurant.(n)
