programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: We Have Put Her Living in the Tomb.
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret agree to pet-sit a tortoise for a friend who ought to know better, and an anniversary outing to the theatre ends in disaster. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Profile of Frankie Howerd, using archive interviews he gave to various TV chat show hosts during the 1970s and 1980s. Howerd is best remembered for the monologues he performed on stage and in sitcoms such as Up Pompeii. Narrated by Tamsin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A weeping statue in the local church gives Del an idea for a money-making scheme to help a hospice under threat of closure. However, his efforts are thwarted by the weather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?.
programme.desc: An old friend returns from Australia flushed with success and offers Del a share in his business empire Down Under. Although the prospect is tempting, it would mean leaving Nelson Mandela House and little brother Rodney behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy becomes a yuppie, complete with red braces, Filofax and chrome briefcase. Meanwhile, Rodney begins attending a computer course at night school, where he meets Cassandra. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A retired jeweller offers Del-Boy the deal of a lifetime - then suddenly has a heart attack and gets taken to hospital with a briefcase containing 250 cut-price gold necklaces still chained to his wrist. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodney's old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's beloved mum apparently makes contact during a seance at the Nag's Head, inspiring him to visit the doctor to seek treatment for stomach cramps. Admitted to hospital for tests, he fears there is something seriously wrong with him - but a bacon sandwich and an alcoholic drink smuggled in by Rodney soon put the smile back on his face. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Return of the comedy about a self-appointed community leader in Sparkhill, Birmingham. Mrs Khan lays down the law when Alia fails her exams, telling her husband to sign up their daughter at the Muslim Academy. But when he finds out how much it costs, he decides there's a better option. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia star.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan is eager to get himself onto the mosque committee, but when he visits the manager to enrol his mother-in-law on an activity course, the conversation ends in a disagreement and the self-appointed community leader walks out in a huff. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Adlyn Ross star.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: A local MP visits the mosque to endorse its mobile health-check unit and Mr Khan takes future son-in-law Amjad as his guinea pig - but things don't quite go to plan. Meanwhile, Mrs Khan and the girls are off to buy clothes for a friend's new baby. Comedy, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Abdullah Afzal, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney ties the knot with Cassandra, but Del has more on his mind than best man duties as the dreaded Driscoll brothers arrive at the Nag's Head baying for his blood over some stolen mobile phones. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The Imam calls a special fast, and Mr Khan uses it to compete with mosque manager Dave - but low blood sugar and a dodgy bladder mean he's a ticking time bomb. So when Mrs Khan insists he visits the building society manager, asking for a loan to put down on a flat for Shazia and Amjad, it turns out it's not one of her best ideas. Comedy, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Matthew Cottle and Maya Sondhi.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Shazia, Amjad and Mrs Khan go off to sample a trial day at an exclusive gym, but Mr Khan is busy trying to secure a famous Pakistani cricketer to operate the tombola at the Eid festival. To help track him down he is using his newfangled gadget - the internet. Having located the man he wants, he arranges to meet him at the mosque - but a case of mistaken identity leads to another mix-up at a yoga class, with Khan, as usual, right in the centre.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan is eager to appear in a video for the mosque, confident that as a fine example of Pakistani manhood, he would be the perfect star. Unfortunately, it seems that director Dave wants to promote a more modern image and chooses Sajid, an attractive, `metrosexual' friend of the family - who at that moment is at home with Mrs Khan. But what are the pair up to? Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor star.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary invents a promiscuous past to hide his sexual inexperience from Dorothy. Meanwhile, Tony tries to impress Deborah with his athletic prowess by turning up at her keep-fit class - but soon regrets his rash move. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: The housemates have a sleepless night as pyjama-clad Gary goes in search of a 24-hour chemist to cure Dorothy's indigestion and Deborah sends Tony to mend a squeaking fence. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Shadow minister Peter Mannion is due to visit to check out the department before the general election - which is yet another distraction for Nicola on a day when nothing seems to be going right. However, while trying to force Glenn and Olly to kick-start her new initiative, she receives an important call. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola accepts an invitation to debate with her shadow Peter Mannion on Richard Bacon's late-night Radio 5 Live programme. However, breaking news changes the whole agenda, ruining both PR teams' well-made plans, and as the airwaves are opened up to listeners, spin doctors converge on the studios. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam (Ashes to Ashes).(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: John Paul calls his cousin to fix his broken computer, silver-haired delinquent Mr Mulvaney has a close shave with the police, and Dee Dee's imagination runs wild when he meets a fruity passenger on the bus. Limmy also finds a colleague skating on thin ice, offers a service to stressed out people, and recalls holidays in Millport.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: The super-computer teaches a cyclist an important lesson, John Paul goes fishing, and a pint of milk is responsible for propelling someone into internet stardom. Plus, game show host Falconhoof gets closer to finding a winner.(n)

programme.title: The Armando Iannucci Shows
programme.desc: A woman wakes up screaming when she remembers she designs bacon packaging for a living, and firemen take up stripping - while putting out fires at the same time. programme.sub-title: The Rabbit and the Pussy Cat.
programme.desc: Timothy joins in a treasure hunt to find a golden rabbit which has been buried in the area. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett and Barbara Lott.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: The boys in blue prepare to be cross-examined by drug-dealer Harry the Spike's formidable defence counsel. Being on the right side of the law, they presume they've got nothing to fear - but they might be wrong.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret set off for a break by the seaside - but the discovery of a dead gull in their boarding-house bathroom sets the scene for what turns out to be a weekend of sheer hell. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Key moments in the career of Ronnie Barker and Ronnie Corbett are recounted by combining clips of chat show appearances with sketches from their comedy series. Talking to the likes of David Frost, Michael Parkinson, Terry Wogan and Russell Harty, they discuss everything from their first meeting through to the very last TV programme they made together, give an insight into the inspiration behind some of their most famous sketches and what made them tick as a duo, and reveal why The Two Ronnies came to a premature end. Dawn French narrates.(n)

programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.sub-title: The King of the Game Shows.
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady presents a retrospective look at the career of comedian Bob Monkhouse, which spanned more than half a century. He reflects on the 1970s and 1980s, when Monkhouse became the undisputed king of the TV game shows, hosting The Golden Shot, Celebrity Squares and Bob's Full House. Featuring rare and often previously unseen archive and contributions from friends.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Social climber Hyacinth finds herself all at sea when she makes an unexpected discovery during a QE2 cruise that threatens to jeopardise her dream trip. Christmas special from 1993, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food takes a gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France, from Bordeaux to Marseille. He samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as exploring a variety of traditional recipes, including artichoke salad with poached egg, eels in cider, and bass with beurre blanc.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food explores the banks of the River Garonne on board a 100-year-old converted barge, and savours the delights of French provincial cooking including magret de canard and petit sale. Other dishes featured are clams in white garlic sauce, eels in parsley and garlic butter, and steak tartare.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's travels take him along the Canal Lateral a la Garonne, where he goes fishing for shad, and is invited to attend a barbecue lunch. He also investigates the produce on offer at Nerac's local market, and joins the villagers of Bruch for a snail dish.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge excursion through south-west France, visiting the city of Agen and tasting the first melon of the season in Quercy before cooking the famous Gascon dish poule au pot.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's travels take him to the River Tarn, where he joins a local angler to fish for pike. He also rustles up a popular confit of duck with braised red cabbage, and meets a chef in Moissac whose dishes are a celebration of seasonal specialities.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge journey through south-west France, sampling the famous sausages as he reaches Toulouse and creating the country's most popular ready-meal cassoulet further downstream.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall sets himself a challenge when he takes charge of a gamekeeper's cottage and develops speargun fishing and hunting skills.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall goes pike fishing in the river Piddle and creates a dish worthy of tempting the reluctant palate of the local keeper. He also teams up with a group of fruit-picking students on Ford Abbey Farm and is rewarded with a bowl of Ukrainian borscht.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Intrepid chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall competes in the Beaminster Summer Show, preparing raspberry jam, chutney and a Victoria sponge. Before the big event, Hugh witnesses the amazing spectacle of thousands of mating spider crabs and manages to rustle up a pasta dish on the quayside.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Mice invade the cottage, so Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall calls in a humane disposal team, who use crystals, sage and kindness to relocate them. The intrepid chef then rustles up a vegan feast for the rodent-busters - high-speed risotto, cooked outdoors.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall orders a wickerwork eel trap and finds a roadkill rabbit the perfect bait. programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall brings home the bacon, reaping the rewards of seven months' hard work, and takes a lesson in catching razor fish. He prepares a feast as a thank-you party for all the friends who have made his stay in Dorset possible.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage

programme.title: Battlechefs

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers get to grips with chocolate in the semi finals, making chocolate tarts for their signature challenge, a chocolate souffle for the technical bake and chocolate centrepieces for the showstopper. As always, the contestants are tasked with producing something that looks and tastes good, before judges Mary and Paul cast a critical eye over their efforts. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The four finalists have two hours to cook a stunning plate of food for Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace, who then send one of them home. The remaining three then travel to Errenteria in northern Spain to spend two days at the world-renowned Mugaritz restaurant to work with chef Andoni Luis Aduriz and his team, before running a service at which they must cook his nine-course tasting menu for specially invited guests and the three judges.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Mississippi Adventure
programme.desc: The duo return to New Orleans, where Simon King tries to convince Dave Myers to enjoy jazz, and cook classic local dishes, including jambalaya and gumbo.(n)

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay embarks on another culinary quest, this time to learn how to cook the dishes of south-east Asia. Starting in Cambodia, he samples delicacies including fried tarantula, stuffed frog and raw duck eggs, and his journey across the country takes him to a tribal wedding feast and a cookery school in Phnom Penh. The visit concludes with him preparing a traditional banquet for the nation's royal family, with help from a talented student.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Cyrus Todiwala (The Incredible Spice Men) to discuss the benefits of wholesome food, with the host challenging the award-winning Indian chef to come up with an alternative take on a curry to rival his own spice-crusted tuna salad. Comedienne Arabella Weir tries her hardest to fall in love with salad, and drinks expert Joe Wadsack picks a selection of healthy red wines.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Host Michel Roux Jr is joined by MasterChef judge and former greengrocer Gregg Wallace to create a meal in which vegetables are the main focus and meat is just the garnish, and resident drinks expert Kate Goodman selects white wines from Portugal that are a perfect match for the food. Plus, chef Florence Knight shows how to cook a little-known by-product of garlic.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers get to grips with chocolate in the semi finals, making chocolate tarts for their signature challenge, a chocolate souffle for the technical bake and chocolate centrepieces for the showstopper. programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin journeys throughout the UK to explore how each region's conditions influence the flavour of local ingredients. After taking to the skies to get an overview of how Britain's landscape and climate affect where, what and how people farm and fish, he then touches down and meets the locals who work the land. He begins in the south east, where he finds out why Kent cherries are so sweet, cooks Hastings Dover sole and prepares a cherry trifle.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey across the UK, as he visits south Wales and discovers why Welsh mountain lamb is a prized delicacy. He also forages for free food on the beaches of Pembrokeshire, and creates two dishes - lamb cooked in hay with a tabbouleh salad and a seafood starter.(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorite figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: The Keenan Vortex. Richard ponders a deal with the tech world's latest "it" boy; Jack faces setbacks(n)

programme.title: T.J. Miller Meticulously Ridiculous
programme.desc: Comedian T.J. Miller performs in Denver at the Paramount Theatre. Topics include nightmares; the differences between alcohol and marijuana; his favorite figure from history; and the challenges of talking about death(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Judge. Daniel woos Jonah to land a coveted interview. Meanwhile, Selina takes a trip; and Amy lobbies Selina to allow her to whip Mike into shape(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Back in the late 1970s, author Cameron Crowe banked upon his youthful appearance to pose as a teen-aged high school student. The results of his hands-on research was the revelatory book Fast Times at Ridgemont High, which went on to spectacular success as a theatrical feature. The sociological inner lining of Crowe's book was sacrificed in favor of standard teen-movie dialogue and Animal House-style comedy, but the film is impossible to dislike, and it spawned a legion of future imitators. Ostensibly, the main characters are brother and sister Jennifer Jason Leigh and Judge Reinhold. However, the real breakthrough star is Sean Penn as the perpetually zoned-out Jeff Spicoli. It is Penn who has the film's most famous scene, wherein the decorum of teacher Hand (Ray Walston)'s classroom is interrupted by a pizza delivery. Fast Times at Ridgemont High was spun off into a TV series, the short-lived 1986 weekly Fast Times(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery is the adventurer who joins Captain Nemo, the Invisible Man, Dorian Gray and other fictional heroes to save the world. FX-packed comic book action(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once again send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but his shock at coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower. Also starring Youki Kudoh and Noémie Lenoir, together with, in unlikely cameos, Max von Sydow and Roman Polanski(n)

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: The world's most enigmatic superhero, Batman ( Michael Keaton ), resurfaces for another Gotham City adventure. This time, he's pitted against villainous freak The Penguin ( Danny DeVito ) and the devious, sexually-charged Catwoman ( Michelle Pfeiffer )(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake (Asa Butterfield) follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. Eva Green, Samuel L. Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. Directed by Tim Burton, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children was adapted from Ransom Riggs' debut novel of the same name(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.desc: A talk show about current events(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A look at the evolution of the firearms industry in the U.S. amid a fundamentally changed political landscape; a report on the potential economic blessing for Russia as world temperatures rise and Arctic sea ice melts(n)

programme.title: The Fight Game With Jim Lampley
programme.desc: Features, interviews and updates on boxing with the veteran sportscaster(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While Santa Claus rewards good children with gifts on Christmas, Krampus, a beast-like creature with demonic appearance, seeks out naughty children and punishes them(n)

programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc: Adaptation of journalist Diana B. Henriques' account of financier Bernie Madoff's orchestration of one of the largest frauds in U.S. history that led to financial ruin for thousands of investors and, in the process, his own family's destruction(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Fast-paced action adventure following a Los Angeles SWAT-team cop's attempts to foil the plans of a deranged bomber. The cop cheats his quarry out of one ransom, but, in response, the psycho contacts him with a warning about a bomb on a bus which will explode if the speed drops below 50mph. With the help of a female passenger, the cop attempts to navigate the bus around the crowded streets of LA while keeping its speed constant(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Hooli-Con. Erlich goes on a trip to get his mojo back while the guys head to Hooli-Con, where Jared faces a moral dilemma; Gilfoyle and Dinesh are distracted by Keenan; and Richard becomes obsessed with an ex's new beau(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after an incident at a fashionable event causes them to be hounded by the paparazzi(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Oscar-winning special effects propel this magical fantasy about the adventures of a brave orphan girl who goes on an epic quest in an alternate world to rescue a kidnapped friend(n)
The true story of Brooklyn Dodgers hitter Jackie Robinson, who in 1946 became the first African-American Major League baseball player(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: An American geologist flies to Antarctica to participate in a project at the United States Research Base, where he teams up with arctic guide Jerry Shepard and his best friend, Cooper. The scientist soon discovers that Shepard also has eight other valuable friends -- a pack of sled dogs he's worked with for years, who have rescued him from a number of tight spots(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: Giddy, crowd-pleasing romp about an English teenager whose dreams of soccer stardom clash with the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: (2005) Enchanting children's fantasy, based on the classic novel by CS Lewis. When young World War Two evacuee Lucy Pevensie hides in an old wardrobe during a game of hide and seek, she finds herself transported to the magical land of Narnia, locked in eternal winter by the evil White Witch. Her siblings do not believe her when she tells them of this strange new world, but they are soon in Narnia themselves, fighting alongside the noble lion Aslan to defeat the witch and her mighty army.Dir: Andrew Adamson. (T) (Digital Dolby 5.1)(n)

In the aftermath of this unprecedented feat, he must endure the weight of sudden fame, second-guessing by investigators and his own doubts about his actions that fateful day(n)

Based on author Maurice Dantec's Babylon Babies, this tale of genetic manipulation comes to the screen courtesy of director Mathieu Kassovitz(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Two bickering, elderly neighbours find that their rivalry heats up when an attractive woman moves in across the road. Comedy(n)

programme.desc: A Trusty Steed. A school evaluator's arrival rattles Gamby and Russell, who cross boundaries with Dr. Brown(n)

programme.desc: Run for the Money. A homecoming football game may be just the thing for Gamby and Russell to bring about Dr Brown's downfall(n)

programme.desc: Circles. Gamby's disciplinary tactics are rebuked by Dr. Brown; Russell clashes with an unruly neighbor(n)

programme.title: Vice Principals
programme.desc: The Foundation of Learning. A shipment of missing books prompts Dr Brown to reprimand a veteran teacher; Amanda and Gamby make a deal(n)

programme.title: Vice Principals

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher

programme.desc: U.K. General Election. The U.K. general election; and former FBI director James Comey's testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee are discussed(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry in this intense thriller. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: From his beginnings on the mean streets of Brooklyn to becoming an East Coast hip-hop sensation, the life and death of rapper Notorious B.I.G. is chronicled in this biopic starring Jamal Woolard and Angela Bassett(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: A rich Wall Street player basks in his late-1980s yuppie lifestyle, but behind his slick appearance lurks a murderous monster(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez stars in this stylish thriller as a psychologist who volunteers to venture inside the mind of a comatose serial killer in order to reveal the whereabouts of his last victim. Vince Vaughn co-stars(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: This sparkling biopic of literary editor Max Perkins centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe. As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels, Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s(n)

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: The Borrowers are the members of a four-inch tall miniature family who live beneath the floorboards of the Lenders, the tenants of the house. When lawyer/Realtor Potter plans to evict the Lenders and demolish the building, a friendship between the two families is the only hope(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: A socially awkward but very bright 15-year-old girl being raised by a single mom discovers that she is the princess of a small European country because of the recent death of her long-absent father, who, unknown to her, was the crown prince of Genovia(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Sports biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards (Taron Egerton), whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics at Calgary marked the first time a Brit had ever competed in the ski-jumping event. Edwards trains as a ski jumper under the tutelage of a hard-drinking former champ (Hugh Jackman), and eventually finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best. Directed by Dexter Fletcher(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse

programme.title: Three O'Clock High
programme.desc: The first feature film from director Phil Joanou (State of Grace), Three O' Clock High chronicles a high school nerd's much hyped after-school bout with the infamous class bully. When the impish Jerry Mitchell (Casey Siemaszko) is assigned to interview the new transfer student with a supposedly violent past, Buddy Revell (Richard Tyson), he makes the fatal mistake of touching his subject. Revell, who hates being touched, responds by challenging the unwilling Mitchell to a fight at three o'clock in the parking lot. Spanning the course of the school day, the film follows the disaster-bound Mitchell as he soils his good-boy image through various misguided attempts at averting the fight. Also making noteworthy appearances in the film are Jeffrey Tambor and Philip Baker Hall(n)

programme.desc: This animated feature from Nickelodeon is the story of ten-year-old genius inventor Jimmy Neutron, whose penchant for gadget-creation gets him and his robot dog, Goddard, into trouble at home and school. However, when the parents of Jimmy's hometown are kidnapped by the gooey green aliens known as Yokians, it's up to Jimmy, his best friend, Carl Wheezer, and his arch rival, Cindy Vortex, to rally their fellow kids for a rescue effort. Patching together a ragtag armada of interstellar spacecraft, the kid invasion force sets out to rescue the moms and dads who love them and get them home in time for dinner. Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius (2001) features the vocal talents of Debi Derryberry, Carolyn Lawrence, Rob Paulsen, Martin Short, Andrea Martin, and Patrick Stewart(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Beauty and the Beast. Happily Ever After always presents a non-traditional look at classic fairy tales. Children learn to look beneath the surface in the African-American version of Beauty and the Beast. An all-star cast populates this story, with Vanessa Williams playing Beauty, Gregory Hines as the Beast, and Paul Winfield playing the father. When Beauty must keep company with the Beast to save her father's life, she is surprised by her change of heart. She soon learns that true goodness can lie beneath a rough exterior. The video features "Could She, Would She, Will She" and "Wave Goodbye." This family friendly program is recommended for ages four to nine(n)

programme.title: The Electric Company
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage heads a stellar cast in David Bowers' animation, adapted from a manga comic-book character, about a robot boy (Freddie Highmore) who is simultaneously trying to save the world and find his place in it. Brilliant scientist Dr Tenma (Cage) is left devastated when his young son is killed during an experiment, and tries to recreate a robotic version of the boy, only to abandon him when he fails to meet expectations. Left to fend for himself, the robot becomes Astro Boy, possessed of a host of useful powers, not the least of which is the ability to fire bullets from his backside. When he becomes embroiled in a plot to exploit a new source of energy, Astro Boy must use all of his gifts to defeat the forces of evil. The array of vocal talent in attendance includes Samuel L Jackson, Donald Sutherland, Bill Nighy, Nathan Lane, Charlize Theron, Kristen Bell and Little Britain's Matt Lucas(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: The Muppets are in London covering a jewel heist(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: Through a series of misunderstandings, Alvin, Simon and Theodore come to believe that Dave is going to propose to his new girlfriend in New York City and dump them. They have three days to get to him and stop the proposal, saving themselves not only from losing Dave but possibly from gaining a terrible stepbrother(n)

programme.title: The Secret of the Magic Gourd
programme.desc: A live-action, Mandarin-language adaptation of the popular 1958 children's book by author Zhang Tianyi, The Secret of the Magic Gourd follows the wondrous adventures of a young schoolboy named Wang Bao. When Wang Bao discovers a magical gourd that can instantly grant his every wish, the awkward child suddenly becomes a hero amongst his curious classmates. When the gourd proves more of a burden than a blessing and the boy decides to get rid of it, he quickly discovers that's easier said than done(n)

programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: An intergalactic package discovered on the beach holds a myriad of fantastic discoveries for siblings Noah and Emma Wilder in The Last Mimzy, studio head-turned-director Bob Shaye's wondrous sci-fi fantasy parable. The children stumble onto their discovery amid a trip to the family beach house, and find inside of the crate strange crystals that Emma levitates with her mind, as well as the Mimzy -- a stuffed bunny with a built-in supercomputer that advances its possessor's brain by great leaps and bounds by whispering into the person's ear. Meanwhile, via interaction with the box and its contents, Noah gains the ability to converse with spiders and instructs them to build miniature bridges. He also etches complex Tibetan mandalas, and somehow manages to black out half of Seattle. The children naturally keep these happenings (and the box) from their mom and dad (Joely Richardson and Timothy Hutton), but in time the kids set their sights higher and embark on correcting huge problems that cannot be missed. Rainn Wilson (The Office) co-stars as the children's hippie science teacher; New Age expert Bruce Joel Rubin (Ghost, Jacob's Ladder) and Toby Emmerich co-authored the script, adapting the 1943 short story Mimsy Were the Borogoves, by Lewis Padgett(n)

But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Snow White. HBO does it again with another addition to their multicultural fairy tale series Happily Ever After Fairy Tales for Every Child. This time, Snow White is a Native American princess White Snow. White Snow is indeed the fairest in the land, much to the chagrin of Sly Fox. Sly Fox summons her powers of dark magic to put a spell on White Snow. White Snow is found and protected by seven tiny turquoise miners. It sounds like the same old story, but these ethnic twists make it seem like an entirely new tale. The voices of Graham Greene and Buffy St. Marie also spruce up this tried and true classic(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures

programme.title: 102 Dalmatians
programme.desc: Glenn Close goes to the dogs once again in this sequel to 101 Dalmatians, Disney's 1996 live-action adaptation of their beloved animated classic. After three years in prison, Cruella De Vil (Close) is judged to have paid her debt to society and is set free, as she pledges to have nothing to do with animal fur (especially dogs) ever again. Meanwhile, Kevin (Ioan Gruffudd) operates an animal shelter that has fallen on hard times; unless he's able to find new financial support, the lost dogs he's been caring for will have nowhere to go. Kevin and his girlfriend Chloe (Alice Evans), who happens to be Cruella's parole officer, get the idea of bringing their plight to the people through the press, but media reports of the shelter's problems attract an unlikely benefactor -- Cruella. While Ms. De Vil claims the purest of intentions, it seems the shelter is housing a large number of dalmatians, and in cahoots with mad fashion designer Monsieur Le Pelt (Gérard Depardieu), she plans to turn the puppies into haute couture. 102 Dalmatians was the first live-action feature for director Kevin Lima, who previously helmed two animated features for Disney, A Goofy Movie and Tarzan(n)

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: Rex Harrison stars in Richard Fleischer's charming adaptation of Hugh Lofting's classic children's book as the eccentric Doctor Dolittle, who can converse with animals in 849 languages. Wrongly imprisoned for releasing a captive seal into the wild, he is rescued by his friend Tommy and the pair set off with Matthew Muggins in search of the mythical pink sea snail(n)

programme.title: Steel
programme.desc: Action-packed adventure about a military scientist who takes to the streets as a hi-tech crusader when his work on a formidable new weapon is hijacked. When a version of his weapon - which neutralises enemies without killing them - starts appearing in the outside world, he dons a special suit and transforms himself into a cartoon-style superhero known as 'Steel'(n)

programme.title: Funny Games
programme.desc: Naomi Watts and Tim Roth star in writer-director Michael Haneke's gripping remake of his acclaimed 1997 Austrian film about a family whose vacation home is invaded by two young men who subject them to a night of psychological and physical torture(n)

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: Thriller starring Joaquin Phoenix, in which the residents of an isolated 19th-century village in Pennsylvania live in fear of mysterious creatures that inhabit the surrounding woodland. Their safety is dependent on not venturing beyond the village boundary, but when a youth decides to seek medical supplies from another community, his adventurism triggers a spate of incidents that instil terror into his fellow villagers(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy about a video store employee and his hapless friend, who, after managing to wipe the films in the shop, must remake all the movies themselves. After being threatened with copyright violation by industry bigwigs, the duo are aided by the store's loyal customers in a bid to make a legitimate and original film about a local hero(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: In this hysterical comedy, two mild-mannered cousins search for a beloved pet kitten after the feline is taken during a home burglary. However, they get in over their heads when their quest leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang by posing as drug dealers(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Young Vincenzo Cortino, son of a Sicilian postman, travels to America to later become the clumsy chief of organized crime with his sons -- short-fused Joey and educated Anthony. One day, Tony makes a mistake and has to leave town. But when assassins try to do away with his father, he sets out for revenge(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor
programme.desc: Jimmie thinks his wild partying days are numbered, so he proposes to Anne, but botches the proposal so badly that Anne leaves town. After she's gone, Jimmie discovers that his recently-deceased grandfather's will stipulates he gets nothing of a multi-million dollar fortune unless he's married by 6.05pm on his 30th birthday, the very next day!(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: Al Pacino delivers an explosive performance as a burnt-out American football coach who finds himself under pressure when the team's owner tries to rejuvenate the losing team(n)

programme.title: Bullet to the Head
programme.desc: A hit man and a New York cop team up to get revenge on the killers who murdered their partners(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live "Weekend Update" co-anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this baby-fever comedy about a single, career-oriented woman who previously put parenthood on hold, and is forced to hire a surrogate mother when she discovers there is only a one-in-a-million chance that she will be able to get pregnant. Kate Holbrook (Fey) is a 37-year-old business executive who has always put her professional life before her personal life, but these days her biological clock is ticking louder than ever before. As with everything else she has accomplished in life, Kate is determined to have a child on her own terms. Unfortunately for Kate, the chance of her ever becoming pregnant is slim to none. Undaunted, a willful Kate drafts South Philly working-class girl Angie Ostrowiski (Poehler) -- a woman who may just be her polar opposite -- to be a surrogate mother. Subsequently informed by the head of the surrogacy center (Sigourney Weaver) that her surrogate is indeed pregnant, the excited mother-to-be soon purchases every child-rearing book she can find and excitedly begins the nesting process. But life hasn't quit throwing Kate curveballs just yet, because when a pregnant Angie shows up on her doorstep with no place to live, the woman who once thrived on order finds her life descending into chaos. Now, as Kate attempts to transform Angie into the ideal expectant mother, this odd couple will discover that families aren't always biological, but occasionally formed through friendship as well. Writer Michael McCullers, who authored the screenplays for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me and Undercover Brother in addition to working on Saturday Night Live, makes his feature directorial debut with a self-penned screenplay(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: This outlandish comedy set in the golden age of showbiz centers on a slick Hollywood fixer named Eddie Mannix, who is pressed into action when a superstar actor is kidnapped and held for ransom. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

Jeremy Piven, Molly Shannon, John Corbett, Bridget Moynahan, Eugene Levy(n)

programme.title: Behind the Candelabra
programme.desc: Filmmaker Steven Soderbergh explores the relationship between flamboyant pianist Liberace (played by Michael Douglas) and his long-term partner, Scott Thorson (Matt Damon), in this Warner Bros. biopic based on Thorson's best-selling memoirs. An pianist with a playful flair for showmanship, Liberace was a beloved entertainer when, in the summer of 1977, he began a five-year love affair with the much-younger Thorson. Though on the surface the pair couldn't have seemed more different, the y quickly established an intimate bond that would take Thorson on a wild ride through the glamorous world of showbusiness while revealing a side of his talented older lover that few had glimpsed before. Rob Lowe, Dan Aykroyd, Scott Backula, and Debbie Reynolds co-star. A considerable hit when it premiered on HBO in May of 2013, Behind the Candelabra impressed at the 2013 Emmy Awards by taking home trophies for Best Mini-Series or TV Movie, Best Actor in a Mini-Series or TV Movie (Michael Douglas), and Best Directing, Mini-Series or TV Movie(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Sick of being bullied by her overpowering Greek family, dowdy Toula signs up for college. Despite every warning, Toula falls for a non-Greek guy, and it's not easy getting her clan to accept him(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: 1992 blockbuster starring Whitney Houston and Kevin Costner - as a singer superstar and her bodyguard who fall in love. Houston hires Costner when she starts receiving death threats from a stalker. The ex-presidential bodyguard has a past, however. He is wracked by guilt over his inability to protect Reagan from John Hinckley's assassination attempt. He's certainly not going to let a bullet slip past himagain and the draconian security measures he sets up are a shock to Houston. But Costner proves his worth when, in the face of death threats, the singer gives the performance of her life at the Oscar ceremony. Houston brings the house down with her performance of the Dolly Parton song 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

programme.title: Get Smart

It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: In this hilarious and heartfelt rom com, four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Two friends set out on a journey of self-discovery, while a career gal struggles with settling down and an uptight romantic searches for her perfect match(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: Giddy, crowd-pleasing romp about an English teenager whose dreams of soccer stardom clash with the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: 1992 blockbuster starring Whitney Houston and Kevin Costner - as a singer superstar and her bodyguard who fall in love. Houston hires Costner when she starts receiving death threats from a stalker. The ex-presidential bodyguard has a past, however. He is wracked by guilt over his inability to protect Reagan from John Hinckley's assassination attempt. He's certainly not going to let a bullet slip past himagain and the draconian security measures he sets up are a shock to Houston. But Costner proves his worth when, in the face of death threats, the singer gives the performance of her life at the Oscar ceremony. Houston brings the house down with her performance of the Dolly Parton song 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

programme.title: Fracture
programme.desc: Anthony Hopkins, Ryan Gosling and David Strathairn star in Gregory Hoblit's twist-filled legal drama. When top airplane engineer Ted Crawford discovers that his wife has been cheating on him he takes a devastatingly direct route to revenge: he drives home and shoots his errant spouse in the face. He then waits for the police to turn up and confesses to the crime. With his wife in a coma, Crawford is arrested and enters the justice system. It should, of course, be the simplest prosecution ever. And lawyer Willy Beachum can be forgiven for thinking that his last case as a criminal attorney (before he switches to company law) will be a doddle. But once in court, Crawford, representing himself, starts to tear apart the ample evidence that's stacked against him... Can he possibly get away with his crime? Also starring Rosamund Pike, Billy Burke and Fiona Shaw(n)

programme.title: The Dancer Upstairs
programme.desc: Thriller following a detective's hunt for a South American guerilla who is stirring up the masses and bringing the country close to collapse under a highly organized terrorist movement. As the anarchist blows up buildings and kills indiscriminately, the detective finds hope and solace in his daughter's ballet teacher as he is forced to choose between love and the country he is trying to protect(n)

programme.title: A Family Is a Family Is a Family: A Rosie O'Donnell Celebration
programme.desc: Rosie O'Donnell examines the evolution of the modern family, and speaks to children about living in households with same-sex, mixed-heritage, single and male-and-female parents. Included: animated segments and musical performances by reggae star Ziggy Marley and folk singer Elizabeth Mitchell. Directed and produced by Amy Schatz(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Romantic comedy in which a newlywed couple on honeymoon in Europe discover that the girl's disapproving family and ex-boyfriend are following them in an attempt to sabotage their relationship(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: A naive man experiences the real world for the first time after being raised in a bomb shelter since the Cuban Missile Crisis. While stocking up on supplies for his still-underground parents, he falls for a cynical '90s gal in this charming rom com(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This re-imagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Wacky comedy about a singer who witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. As a result, the church's congregation swells until even the Pope comes to witness pop classics such as 'My Guy' performed to glorify the Lord. But, of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier is asked to get back into her habit when her old friends at St Catherine's Convent find difficulty in controlling a school filled with juvenile delinquents. But convincing everyone that Deloris is a nun is going to be a challenge in itself(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha (Molly Ringwald) suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork (Anthony Michael Hall) keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake (Michael Schoeffling). Moving from Samantha's family home as it's invaded by outre relatives to a high-school dance where nothing seems to go her way, this bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments of not only Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters, from a hapless Japanese exchange student to a prom queen and a posse of barely pubescent nerds. A climactic party scene at which these various strata of young America overcome their rigid hierarchies sets the stage for resolutions both tender and torrid(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Accused of cheating and desperate to prove his innocence, an eighteen-year-old orphan from the slums of Mumbai reflects back on his tumultuous life while competing to win 20 million rupees on India's Who Wants to Be a Millionaire in Danny Boyle's inspirational drama. Jamal Malik (Dev Patel) may not have a penny to his name, but that could all change in a matter of hours. He's one question away from taking the top prize on India's most popular television game show, but as with everything else in Jamal's life, it isn't going to be easy. Arrested by police under suspicion of cheating, Jamal is interrogated by the authorities. The police simply can't believe that a common "slumdog" could possibly possess the knowledge to get this far in the game, and in order to convince them of how he gained such knowledge, Jamal begins reflecting back on his childhood. As young boys, Jamal and his older brother, Salim, lived in squalor, and lost their mother in a mob attack on Muslims. Subsequently forced to rely on their own wits to survive, the desperate siblings fell back on petty crime, eventually befriending adorable yet feisty young Latika as they sought out food and shelter on the unforgiving streets of Mumbai. Though life on the streets was never easy, Jamal's experiences ultimately instilled in him the knowledge he needed to answer the tough questions posed to him on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire. And though Jamal makes a convincing case for himself, one question still remains: why would a young man with no apparent desire for wealth or fame be so determined to win big on a national game show? Of course, it won't be long until everyone finds out the answer to this burning question, because as Jamal sits down to find out whether he will be rich beyond his wildest dreams, 60 million viewers remain transfixed to their televisions eager to see if he'll correctly answer the final question(n)

programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Is Up All Night
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Is Up All Night. Following a chance meeting with a woman whom he's certain he has met before, Monk (Tony Shalhoub) is unable to sleep. After several slumberless hours, Monk decides to go for a nocturnal walk...only to see the same woman again. Shortly thereafter, Monk witnesses a murder during a botched drug deal, but when he is unable to prove that anything actually went down, it is assumed that he is imagining things because of sleep deprivation. Things get curiouser and curiouser when the so-called murder victim turns up alive. programme.desc: Acid, Spies, & Secret Experiments. programme.title: America's War on Drugs
programme.desc: Cocaine, Cartels & Crack Downs. Cocaine makes its way to America from secret airports, enriching violent cartel bosses, and an infamous "black widow," and the CIA's shadow wars have unintended consequences. President Reagan cracks down as crack invades the U.S(n)

programme.title: America's War on Drugs
programme.desc: Acid, Spies, & Secret Experiments. An exploration of the recreational-drug business and its impact on the U.S. begins with a look at covert Cold War operations that empowered a generation of drug traffickers and reveals details of secret CIA LSD experiments, and President Nixon's crackdown and declaration of a war on drugs(n)

programme.title: Birthday Girl
programme.desc: In Jez Butterworth's debut film, Ben Chaplin plays a bank manager in the very English town of St Albans. Despairing of finding love, he orders mail-order Russian bride Nicole Kidman and is initially delighted with his 'purchase'. But things take a darker turn when her two large and menacing cousins arrive and move in to their tiny house and he realises that not everything bought over the internet comes with a guarantee..(n)

programme.title: Peep World
programme.desc: A family's dirty laundry get aired out in public, and not everyone is happy about it in this dark comedy from director Barry W. Blaustein. Nathan (Ben Schwartz) is a writer who has recently published a best-selling novel that's being made into a major motion picture. Nathan is feeling very good about himself, but his siblings aren't so happy for him -- the book is a very thinly disguised version of his family's wildly dysfunctional history, and nearly everyone close to him can see themselves in its key characters. Nathan's older sister, Cheri (Sarah Silverman), a struggling actress, is so outraged that she's considering taking her brother to court, especially since the film version of the book is being shot outside her apartment and her father's new (and much younger) girlfriend (Alicia Witt) has been cast in the role patterned after her. Nathan's book has also become a thorn in the side of wildly irresponsible Joel (Rainn Wilson), who is on the run from loan sharks, and Jack (Michael C. Hall), whose career as an architect is crumbling almost as quickly as his marriage to Laura (Judy Greer). When the family gathers to celebrate the 70th birthday of their father (Ron Rifkin), along with their mother (Lesley Ann Warren) and her new husband (Nicholas Hormann), it makes for an evening with explosive potential. Peep World also features narration by comedian Lewis Black(n)

programme.title: Kick-Ass
programme.desc: Adapted from Mark Millar's hyper-violent comic book of the same name, director Matthew Vaughn's (Layer Cake) vigilante superhero film tells the tale of an average New York teenager who decides to don a costume and fight crime. Comic book geek Dave Lizewski (Aaron Johnson) may not have good coordination or special powers, but that doesn't mean he isn't a fully capable crime fighter. After purchasing a flashy wet suit on the Internet, Dave starts busting up baddies with nothing but brute force. He calls himself Kick-Ass, and he can take a beating as good as he can dish one out. Before long, Kick-Ass has become a local sensation, and others are following his lead. Big Daddy (Nicolas Cage) and Hit-Girl (Chloe Moretz) are a father-daughter crime-fighting duo who have set their sights on local mob heavy Frank D'Amico (Mark Strong). They're doing a decent job of dismantling Frank's sizable underworld empire when Kick-Ass gets drawn into the fray. But Frank's men play rough, and his son, Chris (Christopher Mintz-Plasse), is about to become Kick-Ass' very first arch nemesis. When Chris assumes the persona of Red Mist, the stage is set for a superhero showdown that could spell the end of Kick-Ass once and for all(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: It's Christmas time in L.A., and there's an employee party in progress on the 30th floor of the Nakatomi Corporation building. The revelry comes to a violent end when the partygoers are taken hostage by a group of terrorists headed by Hans Gruber (Alan Rickman), who plan to steal the 600 million dollars locked in Nakatomi's high-tech safe. In truth, Gruber and his henchmen are only pretending to be politically motivated to throw the authorities off track; also in truth, Gruber has no intention of allowing anyone to get out of the building alive. Meanwhile, New York cop John McClane (Bruce Willis) has come to L.A. to visit his estranged wife, Holly (Bonnie Bedelia), who happens to be one of the hostages. Disregarding the orders of the authorities surrounding the building, McClane, who fears nothing (except heights), takes on the villains, armed with one handgun and plenty of chutzpah. Until Die Hard came along, Bruce Willis was merely that wisecracking guy on Moonlighting. After the film's profits started rolling in, Willis found himself one of the highest-paid and most sought-after leading men in Hollywood(n)

programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: A New York cop tries to deprive terrorists of their quarry at a Washington, DC airport(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Cop John McClane teams with a shop owner to outwit a terrorist who is making him perform a series of dangerous tasks all around Manhattan(n)

programme.title: AVP: Alien vs. Predator
programme.desc: When billionaire Charles Bishop Weyland's satellites detect a pyramid buried under the Antarctic ice, he assembles a team of scientists, archaeologists and engineers to explore it, including Alexa Woods, Sebastian de Rosa and Graeme Miller. They discover that the pyramid is home to two species of aliens. One regards humans as incubators for their young. The other are intergalactic sportsmen who hunt their opposite number for fun. And Weyland's team are caught in the middle. Paul W Anderson's pairing of two of film's most iconic extra-terrestrial monsters is a roller-coaster action movie, with a surprising, shocking coda(n)

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury: Lakeside Walk: Loch Lomond, Scotland.
programme.desc: The presenter heads to Loch Lomond, a freshwater Scottish loch famously celebrated in song that crosses the Highland Boundary Fault and is the largest inland stretch of water in Great Britain by surface area. Taking in the popular West Highland way, it's just a quick boat ride to the idyllic island of Inchailloch, a jewel in the loch's crown, where stunning views over the immense mass of water can be enjoyed.(n)

programme.title: Peston on Sunday
programme.desc: Political magazine, presented by Robert Peston, featuring reports on the latest issues and interviews with topical guests. Allegra Stratton presents a guide to the latest issues on social media.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cruising
programme.desc: The captain of a cruise ship bound for the Mediterranean is less than impressed when five of his regular shipmates are replaced at the last minute. Despite their best efforts to earn his respect and an eagerness to please, the new recruits seem doomed to cause chaos whatever they do. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Liz Fraser and Kenneth Connor.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Voice Kids
programme.desc: Will.i.am, Danny Jones and Pixie Lott all hope to fill their teams with the best young singers in the UK, as the second stage of blind auditions continues. Emma Willis is on hand to meet and greet the junior performers taking to the stage, as each hopes to impress the coaches and secure a chance to win the £30,000 prize - and a family holiday to Disneyland Paris.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.desc: Portugal v Mexico (Kick-off 4.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the opening Group A match for each team, which takes place at Kazan Arena in Russia, and features the champions of Euro 2016 pitted against the 2015 CONCACAF Cup winners. With analysis from Lee Dixon and Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Danny Higginbotham.(n)

programme.title: Britain As Seen on ITV
programme.desc: A selection of clips from the ITV archives showing talented people from around the nation, including a search for budding singers in Wales in the 1960s. Plus, a report on how the man, woman and teenager on the street felt about the career of the Beatles and there is footage revealing how the disco craze hit these shore in the 1970s. Jane Horrocks narrates.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames.(n)

programme.title: The Loch
programme.desc: A human heart is discovered on the shores of the Loch, and forensic psychologist Blake Albrighton is brought in to join the investigating team. He quickly forms a disturbing theory about the motive behind the seemingly inexplicable murders, but Chief Inspector Frank Smilie is quick to dismiss his ideas. However, if the new arrival is correct, the once peaceful Highland community could be set to endure far more deaths, as a serial killer prowls the area. Crime drama, starring Laura Fraser, John Sessions and Don Gilet.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon

As the three delve further into the case, they begin to realise that Leo may not be the only one with a target on his back. Meanwhile, Riggs begins to view Agent Palmer in a new light, while Murtaugh is left worried after Trish makes a spontaneous decision. Damon Wayans, Clayne Crawford and Hilarie Burton star in this fast-paced series, based on the hit, big-screen movie.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Animal Births
programme.desc: Zoologist Lucy Cooke helps out a vet as he performs a caesarean section on a French bulldog as the breed's puppies are difficult to deliver naturally because of their large heads. Lucy then heads to the Channel Islands to visit Jersey Zoo, where she joins staff as they give a silverback gorilla a pregnancy test.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mary tells Sarah that Bethany has run off with Nathan, while Summer is hurt when she hears Todd joking about sending her to a kids' home. Elsewhere, Anna rants at Faye for disobeying her, and Tyrone accuses Kim of having designs on Fiz.(n)

programme.title: Fearless
programme.desc: Released from prison following the retrial, Kevin faces a barrage of abuse from the public - with even his own son Jason calling him a murderer. Only local MP Matthew Wild is able to talk the mob down and with no other option, Emma is forced to take Kevin to her home for his safety. Meanwhile, Heather Myles arrives in England and pays Cambridge master Sir Alistair McKinnon a visit to get as much information as possible from him about Emma. Thriller, starring Helen McCrory, with Michael Gambon and Sam Swainsbury.(n)

programme.title: The Real Full Monty
programme.desc: Twenty years after the release of The Full Monty, a group of male celebrities come together to recreate the famous striptease from the movie and raise awareness of men's health issues. Alexander Armstrong and Ashley Banjo recruit their fellow famous faces, including Emmerdale's Matthew Wolfenden (David Metcalfe), McFly drummer Harry Judd, actor Danny John-Jules and dancer Wayne Sleep, before putting them through their paces for the performance in front of 2,000 people at the London Palladium. But with little time to rehearse and the show fast approaching, will they are dare to bare all for a good cause?.(n)

programme.title: Freaky Friday

As the mortified mum rediscovers the highs and lows of adolescence and her daughter gets to grips with working life, they finally begin to understand each other. Disney comedy remake, with Jamie Lee Curtis and Lindsay Lohan.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dolly's husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve Crane's wayward mother Babs arrives in Aidensfield, having fallen out with her screenwriter boyfriend and grown tired of the London arts scene. She causes all manner of chaos when a spate of burglaries provides her with the ideal opportunity to put her self-defence skills into practice. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps has an amazing change in fortune. Rural drama, starring James Carlton.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica attends a writers' seminar in Amsterdam and ends up investigating the disappearance of an old friend, suspected to have been kidnapped. Starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American businessman travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris tries to hire Hercule Poirot to discover the source of the death threats that have been made against him. The sleuth refuses, but wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow - and there is no shortage of suspects among the passengers. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Sean Connery and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American businessman travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris tries to hire Hercule Poirot to discover the source of the death threats that have been made against him. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Ingrid Bergman, Sean Connery and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: A blizzard forces the sleuthing spinster to spend a night in isolated Sittaford House, situated on a Devon moor. Without explanation, the building's owner, up-and-coming politician Clive Trevelyan, decides to spend the evening in a local hotel - only for a Ouija board to predict his murder. Mystery drama with an all-star cast, including Geraldine McEwan, Robert Hardy, Matthew Kelly, Patricia Hodge and Mel Smith.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: Foyle responds to complaints of sabotage at an RAF burns hospital and uncovers adultery and murder within the medical unit. As the hunt for the guilty party intensifies, the detective discovers his son Andrew could be a suspect and is shocked when he hears he has been reported missing from his barracks. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, John Wood, Honeysuckle Weeks and Julian Ovenden.(n)

programme.title: Tonight at the Palladium
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the revived variety show, introducing a line-up of acts from around the world. Topping the bill are disco legends Earth, Wind & Fire with a selection of their greatest hits, and fellow American band Maroon 5 make a rare UK appearance to perform Maps. Former X Factor contestant Ella Henderson performs the song Glow, and Evita star Madalena Alberto graces the stage with a classic song from the musical. Plus, Canadian acrobats Les 7 Doigts de la Main and some of the biggest names in comedy.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Animal Orphans
programme.desc: Comedian Paul O'Grady presents the second of two reports from Borneo. He meets a five-year-old orang-utan that broke its arm in a fall from a tree, and is now having physiotherapy. But even if the fracture heals, will the patient have the confidence to start climbing again? The comedian also visits a centre dedicated to the conservation of sun bears - after pandas, the second most endangered bears in the world - and is introduced to a slow loris. Often sold illegally as pets, this one was so stressed it chewed off its own fingers and now needs to be taught to eat its usual diet of insects.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress flies over Tokyo in a helicopter. The city was bombed extensively during the Second World War, so almost all of it is a symbol of the post-war economic boom that saw Japan become the world's second largest economy. While in the capital, Joanna heads out to a nightclub to see a Japanese girl band and witnesses the largely male audience perform almost as much as the artists on stage. Later, Joanna travels to the Kiso Valley to walk the Nakasendo Way, an ancient route that once linked Tokyo to Kyoto, a place best known for that most famous of Japanese traditions, the Geisha.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam are given 10 hours to find a hostage who was taken by two armed men, following a bungled robbery in which an innocent `have-a-go-hero' was shot dead. When one of the accused is seized, the team is offered a deal - he will tell them the location of the captive in return for immunity from prosecution. Tamzin Outhwaite guest stars as uncompromising lawyer Miriam Pescatore.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks is forced to reopen a 14-year-old case when a dying crack addict confesses to the murder of teenager Amanda Bennet, a crime for which her father Simon (guest star Tim McInnerny) was originally convicted. Brooks becomes torn between the belief of his former partner Bernie Rawlins and mounting doubts over the ability of current colleague Casey, and the case unearths the possibility that more ghosts from his drinking days will come back to haunt him. Starring Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: The team members are baffled as they struggle to build up a profile of the person they are hunting, as there is no discernible pattern to the crimes, or any clear motive. Meanwhile, Tony has an encounter with a mysterious woman, and Carol oversees a case review that entangles her in police politics and personal deception. Starring Robson Green and Hermione Norris.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood

Meanwhile, a spate of random shootings spreads terror throughout Bradfield, and Carol comes under pressure to bring the sniper responsible to justice. Robson Green and Hermione Norris star.(n)

programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh comes to the aid of the Costellos in Norwich, who have recently moved into a bungalow with a garden in desperate need of a makeover. The team aims to provide areas of relaxation, beauty and play, with David Domoney finding a way to stimulate the kids' imagination on a budget.(n)

At the Royal, a painfully thin girl causes concern for Goodwin - whose green-eyed monster emerges when student nurse Samantha Beaumont agrees to a date with a younger man - and the hospital is evacuated after a suicide victim's corpse is brought in emitting toxic fumes. Medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Paul Fox and Anna Madeley.(n)

programme.desc: George seeks solace when his budgie dies, but Mildred is too preoccupied with finding something good enough to donate to the jumble sale. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The murder of a caretaker has been so carefully planned and executed that the police are left without a single piece of evidence. Brooks and Casey eventually track down the killer, who confesses, but the trial is put in jeopardy by a canny defence lawyer. Guest starring Toby Stephens.(n)

As he embarks on his deadly mission of vengeance, he learns his son also survived the attack, but was told he is dead. Thriller, with Steven Seagal, Kelly LeBrock, Bill Sadler and Frederick Coffin.(n)

However, their last appearance was in 2005, when they finished bottom of their group, and they face a tough task against the world champions, who were third when they last entered this tournament 12 years ago on home soil. programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade `monster' cases usually involve freshwater culprits, after hearing multiple reports of a deep-water serial killer in Mexico's Sea of Cortez, he decides to step out of his comfort zone and into unchartered depths. programme.title: Car Crash Britain

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A coach crash on the M62 causes chaos for the staff as A&E is overrun with patients needing treatment, while Sam is shocked to find her badly beaten brother waiting at reception. Starring Martin Shaw and James Murray.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Dashing TV doctor James Da Costa sets pulses racing as he arrives to attend an interview for the post of clinical director, although he fails to impress his old teacher Jack, who doesn't relish working alongside his egotistical former star pupil. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.desc: Nick's relationship with Kate suffers when he goes for a job interview in London, and Greengrass is convicted for sheep rustling, although holes in the evidence are discovered. programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.desc: Captain Hammond's former batman tries to blackmail Lady Marjorie with incriminating letters she wrote three years previously. Seventies drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Angela Baddeley and Joan Benham.(n)

programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber.(n)

programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part One.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: Peril at End House - Part Two.

David Suchet stars, with Philip Jackson and Hugh Fraser.(n)

Drama adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Hidden Depths, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Gina McKee, Wunmi Mosaku, Paul Ritter and Neil Armstrong.(n)
