programme.desc: Drama set in a shanty town in 1870s Yorkshire Dales, home to a diverse community of pioneers, settlers and outcasts building a railway viaduct. Jessica Raine stars as penniless widow Annie Quaintain, who arrives with her teenage children and ends up setting up a boarding house for the labourers. But she is not the only new arrival in town. Handsome navvy Johnny is returning to his native Yorkshire from Africa - only to make violent enemies with a hot-tempered colleague. Hans Matheson, Clarke Peters, Daniel Rigby and Amy James-Kelly co-star.(n)

Angela succumbs to her feelings for Otto, but before anything can happen, Elizabeth and Thomas give her a cruel and humiliating reminder that he is a married man. David Jason stars in the final episode of the Dickens-inspired drama, with Annabelle Apsion, Jan Francis, Michael Cochrane and Michael Troughton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Nick tackles a tidy burglar who insists on clearing up the houses he robs, and investigates a suspicious church organist. Starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: David Suchet takes on his final case as the Belgian sleuth in the last-ever episode of the long-running drama. Crippled with arthritis, Poirot is now using a wheelchair and has a life-threatening heart condition, but remains as sharp as ever. Calling on old friend Captain Hastings for assistance, he returns to Styles, where the pair first met 30 years earlier on a murder investigation. The detective is convinced the country house is once again harbouring a killer, and as guests fall victim to a mysterious attacker, he must summon the last of his strength to battle his ultimate nemesis. With Hugh Fraser, Anne Reid, Philip Glenister, Helen Baxendale, Matthew McNulty, Anna Madeley and Shaun Dingwall.(n)

programme.desc: Stan and Oleg wrestle with the harsh consequences of their complicated history, while Philip and Elizabeth face a new mission with devastating implications for their country.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Jeffrey Marsalis, who had both charm and good looks but was a sexual predator and would take women on dates and drug them. Two of his victims, JoAnn Buttaro and Jessika Rovell, recall their experiences.(n)

programme.desc: Insight into the manhunt for tracker Claude Dallas, who shot two sheriffs dead before disappearing into the mountains of Idaho. Knowing Dallas could stay hidden indefinitely, the FBI were forced to employ unique tactics and set up a modern-day posse to track him down.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of 13-year old Christina Long. After a troubled childhood, she lived with her aunt. However, she was strangled by a married restaurant worker she had met on the internet.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: Revisiting the case of 21-year-old Wendy Trapaga, whose body was found four days after her wedding in October 2002. Police focused on husband Michel Escoto's life insurance policy, and considered the involvement of an ex-girlfriend, Yolanda Cerrillo.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town

programme.title: Forensic Detectives

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A team of experts analyses the remains of a woman found in woods two years after she was reported missing. Plus, police uncover clues to the murder of a night porter.(n)

programme.desc: The case of a hairdresser, initially suspected of fatally overdosing on heroin. However, a detective followed a hunch and launched a operation to find her killer.(n)

programme.desc: A vintage case in which a mechanic was found dead with a bullet wound to the head. Suicide was suspected, but then-rookie detective Rod Demery considered it murder - the first of his career.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town

Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before an old tip led detectives out of state to find their man.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Ajay hopes her nautical-themed evening will see her sail to victory on the fifth and final night in Devon. Along with a gigantic seafood spread, she has also laid on a boat trip around Torquay harbour. However, all does not go quite to plan in the galley. The guests later gather to discover who has won the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. A trip to Gaynor's local brewery turns out to be a barrel of laughs when one guest beats another in a cask-rolling competition, before a broken cooker creates chaos in the kitchen the following morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Outfields Farm Bed and Breakfast in Ravensden, Bedfordshire, on their second stay, where proprietors Graham and Julia Ashley treat them to an afternoon of indoor sky-diving before hosting a dinner filled with surprises. The guests enjoy a good night's sleep, but one of the owners is expecting hassle at breakfast time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, west London, where artist Bob Osbourne appears to take a rather laid-back approach to running his B&B. On arrival, guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impressions of the communal living space-come-mini art gallery - but it's not long before they are dishing the dirt.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition draws to a close at the Ammonite Lodge guesthouse in Chard, Somerset, where owners Andrew and Clare Ashmore hope to excite their guests with a game of skittles. During the final dinner of the week, the competitors discuss their first impressions of each other, and Bob and Julia share some amusing observations with the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners confront their critics face to face, and the winners are announced. Nateby Inn host Gaynor takes issue with Graham and Julia's reduced marks for cobwebs. The conversation becomes heated when Outfields Farm's owners tackle Gaynor's complaints in return, and Georgie jumps to their defence. Artist Bob Osborne has a long list of grievances he wants to address, and Julia is left cringing when her previous comments rebound on her.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Performing arts teacher Helen hosts the first dinner party in Sheffield, but her flamboyant cooking does not go to according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Design and technology teacher Claire hosts the second day of the competition in Sheffield, and hopes her Asian-inspired menu with a spot of clay model-making will impress her fellow diners enough to net her the points she'll need to secure the cash prize. However, former chef Simon Hollings proves difficult to faze, and the eccentric Helen irritates the other contestants with another audacious display at the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Service administrator Monika hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Sheffield. She treats her guests to a traditional Bulgarian night inspired by her homeland, in the hope of impressing them enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, some of the guests are unsure about her Bulgarian delicacies, and the host must fight for control when the two teachers go head-to-head and when Simon makes sexist jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Sheffield sees musician Ivor's turn to host, and he is determined to make it a fun evening with a menu inspired by 1980s pop and a performance by his new romantic band.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former chef Simon hosts the final meal in Sheffield, but is unlikely to get an easy ride from his guests following all the criticism he has dished out at the earlier soirees. He also has to contend with the feud that's brewing between Claire and Helen, and when things boil over between the women, Monika doesn't know where to hide.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow Chester Zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins who are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They're keen to make a break for it and join the adults, but when they're finally free to go they have other ideas. Elsewhere, Niall the chimpanzee keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years. When the ape captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Craggy Island's most famous religious relic is due to be upgraded and Ted sets about trying to ensure the ceremony runs smoothly. However, Dougal and Jack put his plans in jeopardy when they meet the three priests in charge of proceedings. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Dougal allows himself to be led astray by rebellious new arrival Father Damien, and Ted is suspected of being the criminal mastermind behind a scandalous theft. Comedy, with Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Joe Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Parenting for Idiots
programme.desc: Light-hearted documentary in which a cast of famous faces reveal the many sides of modern parenting in a succession of magic moments and horror stories, while child-free celebrities experience the realities of looking after a child for the first time. Episode one focuses on the different types of chaos that ensue from having children, with Sally Phillips discussing living with nits, Frankie Boyle revealing how his children embarrass him, and Andrew Flintoff divulging a few truths about the Tooth Fairy. Plus, non-parents Jamie Laing and Mark-Francis Vandelli get a taste of parenthood by looking after a five-month-old baby for the day.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr invites Sean Lock and Rob Beckett to go up against Jon Richardson and Cariad Lloyd in the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz. Jamie Laing joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to family-owned Italian restaurant Giuseppi's in Macomb Township, Michigan. Father and son Joe and Sam Borgia's constant fighting is driving customers away, and Gordon discovers one of the restaurateurs is concealing a serious health problem. Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Craggy Island's most famous religious relic is due to be upgraded and Ted sets about trying to ensure the ceremony runs smoothly. However, Dougal and Jack put his plans in jeopardy when they meet the three priests in charge of proceedings. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Dougal allows himself to be led astray by rebellious new arrival Father Damien, and Ted is suspected of being the criminal mastermind behind a scandalous theft. Comedy, with Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Joe Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Parenting for Idiots
programme.desc: Light-hearted documentary in which a cast of famous faces reveal the many sides of modern parenting in a succession of magic moments and horror stories, while child-free celebrities experience the realities of looking after a child for the first time. Episode one focuses on the different types of chaos that ensue from having children, with Sally Phillips discussing living with nits, Frankie Boyle revealing how his children embarrass him, and Andrew Flintoff divulging a few truths about the Tooth Fairy. Plus, non-parents Jamie Laing and Mark-Francis Vandelli get a taste of parenthood by looking after a five-month-old baby for the day.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by guests Christian Jessen, Lorraine Kelly, Sarah Millican and Tom Rosenthal, who answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today. Extended edition of the irreverent panel show, presented by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman meet Hampshire couple Eric and Maria, who are looking to find a retirement home but have different ideas about where to relocate. They are split between settling in Romsey, where they will be closer to friends and family, or finding a home in Collioure, France.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Rescued bulldog Dolly is having trouble with all four legs, police dog Anya's spine has been badly damaged, and a retired greyhound called Lola has a mystery problem. `Bionic Vet' Noel Fitzpatrick does what he can to help them at the pioneering veterinary practice.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Beverly Green welcome their guests to Centery Farm, Devon, where one contestant decides to keep her past as a hotel inspector secret. The couple's afternoon herding activity is thwarted by heavy rain and fog, and the following morning's feedback showdown has repercussions that will be felt all week.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Professional chef Ben Cooke invites the contestants to the Little Gloster on the Isle of Wight, where he hopes to impress them with a taste of Scandinavian living. Assisted by his 81-year-old grandmother Lillian, who has more than 50 years' experience in the hotel industry, the host splits the visitors into two teams for a contest, but simmering tensions quickly reach boiling-point, resulting in a bitter snub at dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Stephen Hammon hosts the third day of the competition at the four-star Old Hall House B&B in Warwickshire, providing his guests with a variety of on-site activities including shooting and archery before taking them for a meal at his own restaurant. However, he ends up trying too hard to impress at breakfast the next day after Sandie De Rougemont reveals her past as a hotel inspector.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ex-hotel inspector Sandie De Rougemont, owner of the House of Agnes in Canterbury, plays host. She takes her guests to a local brewery and an upmarket restaurant, where everyone seems to enjoy themselves, but the revelation that a ghost may roam the rooms of the B&B leaves some of the participants nervous.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton heads for the south of France to help passionate Francophile Ruth locate the perfect retirement property. Meanwhile, Luke Doonan is approached by her daughter Anni, who is concerned about her mother's plans to emigrate and asks him to find an alternative home in Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: House-hunters Chris and Milton wish to relocate somewhere they can grow their own vegetables and indulge their love of culture, so experts Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman are on hand to show them a variety of properties in Dorset and Croatia to aid them in making their decision.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team excavate the remains of a Roman market town hidden beneath the small Monmouthshire village of Caerwent. The archaeologists are puzzled by the discovery of a maze of walls, and other finds - including a child's toy, evidence of street food and a rare knife handle carved into the shape of two fighting gladiators - prove this was a bustling community.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Rise Hill, North Yorkshire: Blood, Sweat and Beers.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate a Victorian settlement lived in by railway navvies in Rise Hill, North Yorkshire. The construction of the Settle to Carlisle railway took five years and involved digging a tunnel three-quarters of a mile long through solid rock. The archaeologists find the houses and workshops that were built on the isolated hill and uncover stories of murder, suicide and heroic endurance.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The pets with problems this week include a rare breed of bulldog called Cyrus, who has multiple issues, a lame husky named Ghost, and a Maltese-bichon frise cross suffering from seizures. Plus, Bucklersbury Bear, a huge Newfoundland, finds a new lease of life post-surgery - in the water.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to South Yorkshire to plan to surprise the daughter of an amateur off-road champion by restoring her late mother's Series 1 Land Rover.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Robert and Milla Gaukroger who, when he last saw them, were in danger of their bank foreclosing on their unfinished timber house with views of Lake Windermere. They had begun construction with only a quarter of the £400,000 budget needed, and the physical effort of turning the 1980s property into an eco-home that mirrored the surrounding mountains had begun to put Robert's health at risk.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary charting the work of staff at St George's A&E continues, this time focusing on the stories of patients whose friendships have seen them through good times and bad. Phil, a 60-year-old bricklayer, is rushed in after suffering multiple injuries following a short fall from a ladder at work, and his business partner Paul discusses how the pair bonded over the course of 28 years. Meanwhile, 93-year-old widow Violet arrives after fracturing her leg while preparing to go out for lunch with the friends who have supported her since the death of her husband, and 18-year-old dance student Shiana comes to A&E with her mother and her best friend, after injuring her ankle during a rehearsal.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This edition focuses on the rise in violent crime across the UK and the increase in attacks on police officers. PCs Matt Ambrose and Mike Lowe are dispatched to a house in Crewe following reports of a man threatening his ex-partner with a gun, and later are called to a local sports club where a brawl is underway and they find themselves dangerously outnumbered. PC Claire Heatley arrests a male motorcyclist suspected of drink-driving, but becomes the victim of a vicious assault when the suspect headbutts her.(n)

programme.desc: Oscar-nominated animated comedy adventure about a group of prehistoric animals who brave the elements to return a human baby to its father. Sid (John Leguizamo), a goofy and talkative sloth, wakes up to find that everyone's started to migrate south to avoid the onset of the Ice Age. Afraid of being deserted, he tags along with Manfred (Ray Romano), an embittered mammoth who's decided he'd rather head north. After stumbling across a human camp that's under attack by a pride of sabre-toothed tigers and narrowly saving a baby, they're joined by Diego, a sabretooth who convinces them he can help return the child by tracking the humans. However, he's actually a member of the same pride - and is plotting to guide them into an ambush. Can Manny and Sid find the baby's father and avoid the frozen weather? Or will Diego's plan mean they never make it? Also featuring the voice of Jack Black(n)

programme.title: Futurama

programme.sub-title: The Day the Earth Stood Stupid.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist examines the world of flight, travelling across the globe to chart the evolutionary story of those creatures who seemingly defy the rules of gravity by taking to the air. Initially focusing on insects, Attenborough meets a descendant of the dragonfly, before examining the Atlas beetle, which tends to restrict flight to times when it needs a mate or a fresh supply of food. More aesthetically pleasing is a group of beautiful tropical butterflies, followed by an in-depth study into the blow fly - the jet fighter of insects.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist visits the jungles of Borneo to meet creatures that like to glide through life - the harlequin tree frog and the little-known colugo - often referred to, incorrectly, as a flying lemur. He also has a CGI-assisted encounter with the first true vertebrate flyer, the pterosaur, receives a flying lesson from a small flock of swans at Loch Lomond in Scotland and encounters the planet's largest species of bat.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies

He begins with the vast bird family, watching a group of vultures as they go scavenging and some peregrine falcons dive bombing for their prey. He then moves on to the floating forests of Ecuador to find out what makes the humble hummingbird tick, before ending his journey at the Gomantong bat caves of Borneo - a place he first filmed in 1972 - witnessing a mass exodus of the creatures.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The adults take a trip to Las Vegas, where Jay wheels and deals to get them some better rooms - including their very own British butler, played by Stephen Merchant. programme.desc: The gang members get together to have their family photo taken, with Gloria on hand to organise everyone. and Phil tracks down the record he lost his virginity to, but soon regrets it when it makes him feel as if he's being unfaithful to Claire. His interest is also piqued when a couple of his nerdy colleagues come up with a cutting-edge particle accelerator that should offer massive advances in power and medicine. But when the grand unveiling is interrupted by a freak weather storm and Barry is struck by lightning, he ends up spending nine months in a coma - only to wake up feeling much speedier than ever before. Pilot episode of the superhero adventure, starring Grant Gustin, with Candice Patton and Rick Cosnett.(n)

Events have taken their toll on local hero Oliver, who has retired and gone back to Lian Yu, the island where he was stranded and tortured for five years. Diggle and Felicity manage to track him down - but can they persuade him he is still needed back home? Meanwhile, Thea is refusing to visit mum Moira in prison, Roy has decided to give crimefighting a proper go in Oliver's absence, and a troublesome businesswoman has arrived in town.(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bumbling Inspector Clouseau's adventures seem to have come to an end when he is mistakenly declared dead. However, the disaster-prone detective is in fact alive and well, and takes advantage of the situation to launch an undercover investigation into his own murder, adopting a variety of cunning disguises. Comedy sequel, starring Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Burt Kwouk and Dyan Cannon.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: The cast of a cancelled sci-fi series are reduced to a life of conventions and public appearances, only to find themselves genuinely transported into space. Naive aliens have mistaken the show for real life and want the actors to help defend them from an evil extraterrestrial warlord. Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: After accidentally knocking Kate Moss into the Thames, hapless champagne-swigging friends Patsy and Edina are hounded by the paparazzi. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Homer unwittingly pollutes Lake Springfield, so the US government decides to isolate the city underneath a giant dome. The Simpsons manage to escape and plan to start a new life in Alaska - but learn Springfield is about to be destroyed, and return to save their friends. With the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse delays proposing to his girlfriend until he has won the approval of her strict father, a former CIA agent who does not suffer fools gladly, and vows to be on his best behaviour during a visit to her family home. However, his efforts to impress soon collapse into a catalogue of disasters. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: After accidentally knocking Kate Moss into the Thames, hapless champagne-swigging friends Patsy and Edina are hounded by the paparazzi. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Gremlins 2: The New Batch
programme.desc: Cute furball Gizmo is reunited with his human friends Billy and Kate, who now work in the New York offices of an eccentric tycoon. However, it is not long before Gizmo has spawned a new generation of murderous carnivores, who quickly overrun the building - and a genetics lab where they produce even more startling mutations. Joe Dante's comedy sequel, starring Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, John Glover and Christopher Lee.(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: A hapless spy is assigned to track down an underground arms dealer who has stolen a prototype jet fighter. His superiors decide the best way for him to get close to his target is to pose as an assistant to an egotistical boxing champion, who revels at the chance to become a secret agent. Spy comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Eddie Murphy, Owen Wilson, Famke Janssen and Malcolm McDowell.(n)

programme.title: Death Becomes Her
programme.desc: Two romantic rivals are both granted the secret of eternal youth by a mysterious mystic. However, as they battle to get their claws into a plastic surgeon, they discover their now-immortal bodies are capable of taking whatever damage they can dish out. Black comedy fantasy, starring Goldie Hawn, Meryl Streep, Bruce Willis and Isabella Rossellini.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romantic novelist goes in search of her kidnapped sister in the steamy jungles of South America, only to become the target of a villainous general who demands as a ransom the valuable treasure map in her possession. Help is at hand in the form of a craggy daredevil fortune hunter, who has his eye on a share of the profits. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: A lazy twentysomething lives off his wealthy hotel magnate father. When the old man decides to retire, he begins to question whether his layabout son is suitable to take over the family empire and issues a challenge - he must retake 12 years of school in 24 weeks, or lose everything. Comedy, starring Adam Sandler, Bridgette Wilson, Darren McGavin and Bradley Whitford.(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots
programme.desc: A pilot joins an elite squad to take part in a dangerous mission, but faces a struggle to live down his father's bad reputation - and win the love of a glamorous psychiatrist. Comedy spoofing action movies - principally Top Gun - starring Charlie Sheen, Lloyd Bridges, Valeria Golino, Cary Elwes, Kevin Dunn and William O'Leary.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: A male stripper who retired from the stage three years ago is persuaded to put on one last show. A troupe of dancers are also planning to call it a day and recruit him to headline their final show. The guys head off on a road trip to the venue, making some new friends and picking up a few new moves along the way. Drama sequel, starring Channing Tatum and Joe Manganiello.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Premiere. When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: A couple on the brink of divorce sign up for relationship therapy on a tropical island, but find they can save money if they persuade their friends to join them. Three more couples go along for the holiday, thinking they do not need any help - but the unconventional treatment soon exposes cracks in their relationships. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn, Malin Akerman, Jon Favreau and Jason Bateman.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Premiere. When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: A couple on the brink of divorce sign up for relationship therapy on a tropical island, but find they can save money if they persuade their friends to join them. Three more couples go along for the holiday, thinking they do not need any help - but the unconventional treatment soon exposes cracks in their relationships. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn, Malin Akerman, Jon Favreau and Jason Bateman.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: An intrepid treasure-hunter follows a series of ingenious clues in a perilous quest to track down a war chest hidden by America's founding fathers generations before. He has to contend with determined rivals in the shape of a treacherous associate and the FBI. Action adventure, starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Sean Bean and Justin Bartha.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck barman is having a hard time coping after his wife leaves him and he loses his teaching job. His fortunes turn around when the American football team he has supported all his life holds open trials and, against all odds, he wins a place on the squad. Fact-based sporting drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: The Great Mouse Detective
programme.desc: The evil Professor Ratigan masterminds a cunning plan to become supreme ruler of all mousedom by kidnapping a clever toy-maker and forcing him to participate in his evil schemes - but super-sleuth Basil of Baker Street is soon on the case. Animated adventure, with the voices of Vincent Price, Barrie Ingham, Val Bettin and Alan Young.(n)

programme.title: A Goofy Movie
programme.desc: The Disney cartoon dog takes his son on an old-fashioned fishing trip in an attempt to bond with the lad. However, young Max has boasted to his pals that he is going to a pop concert in Los Angeles, and has a few ideas on how to trick his dopey dad. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Bill Farmer, Jason Marsden and Wallace Shawn.(n)

programme.title: Son of Flubber
programme.desc: An eccentric inventor thinks he can make it rich by developing a means to control the weather, but his efforts end in as series of disasters. Disney's comedy sequel to The Absent Minded Professor, starring Fred MacMurray, Nancy Olson, Keenan Wynn and Tommy Kirk.(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Hound 2
programme.desc: Sequel to the Disney animation, in which Copper the dog joins a country music band of strays. However, his taste of fame leads him to neglect old friend Tod the fox. With the voices of Patrick Swayze, Reba McEntire, Harrison Fahn and Jonah Bobo.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch
programme.desc: The odd couple return for this animated sequel, in which the lovable, loopy alien gives his adopted family more problems thanks to a major malfunction. With the voices of Dakota Fanning, Tia Carrere and Holliston Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Stitch! The Movie
programme.desc: Animation following the further adventures of the little alien, as a host of his fellow experimental creatures arrive on Earth. However, their chaotic efforts to make themselves at home are threatened by the evil Captain Gantu, who is hot on their heels and determined to capture them. With the voices of Chris Sanders, Daveigh Chase, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Pete's Dragon
programme.desc: A young boy orphaned by a car crash and left alone in a forest befriends a giant, fire-breathing dragon. Fantasy adventure, starring Bryce Dallas Howard, Robert Redford and Oakes Fegley.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast

Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Pete's Dragon
programme.desc: A young boy orphaned by a car crash and left alone in a forest befriends a giant, fire-breathing dragon. Fantasy adventure, starring Bryce Dallas Howard, Robert Redford and Oakes Fegley.(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam grudgingly undertake a bizarre mission - to help their native hosts by transporting a fully-grown elephant through 200 miles of rough jungle terrain. They soon hit upon a novel way of delivering the beast, deciding to load it into a plane, and then parachute it to its destination. Comedy, starring Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary and Doug E Doug.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecked
programme.desc: A youngster joins a sailing ship to raise money to save his parents' farm, but soon finds himself mixed up in adventure after being thrown overboard and washed up on an island inhabited by a gang of pirates. Disney adventure, starring Gabriel Byrne, Stian Smestad and Louisa Haigh.(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride
programme.desc: The one-time leader of the gunslinging band, now a marshal, turns down an old ally's call for help in dealing with a gang of Mexican bandits. However, when the desperados kill his friend and his own wife, the lawman puts together a new team and sets out to take revenge. Western sequel, with Lee Van Cleef, Stefanie Powers, Mariette Hartley and Michael Callan.(n)

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Seven youngsters discover an old map and set out on the adventure of a lifetime to save their homes from a land developer by finding a legendary pirate's hidden treasure. However, they first have to navigate a series of booby-trapped underground caverns and outwit a family of crooks also after the loot. Children's adventure, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman, Josh Brolin and Martha Plimpton.(n)

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: After the re-emergence of the world's first mutant world-destroyer Apocalypse, the X-Men must unite to defeat his extinction level plan. Sci-fi adventure, starring James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender and Jennifer Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Batman Forever
programme.desc: The masked crimefighter takes on the twin threats of disfigured maniac Two-Face and insane genius the Riddler, who are plotting to control the brains of the entire world. Meanwhile, an acrobat whose family has been murdered by Two-Face steps up to join Batman in his fight against evil. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Val Kilmer, Tommy Lee Jones, Nicole Kidman, Jim Carrey and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth.(n)

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: After the re-emergence of the world's first mutant world-destroyer Apocalypse, the X-Men must unite to defeat his extinction level plan. Sci-fi adventure, starring James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender and Jennifer Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Underworld
programme.desc: A vampire fights a war against werewolves that has raged for centuries, with the human race oblivious to the conflict. She falls in love with a mortal man who has wandered unwittingly into the midst of a conflict, and must protect him from both the enemy, who have plans for him, and her own side. Supernatural action thriller, starring Kate Beckinsale, Scott Speedman, Michael Sheen and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV
programme.desc: The Italian Stallion agrees to help former champion Apollo Creed train for a match against a seemingly invincible boxer from the Soviet Union, only to see his friend die as a result of injuries sustained in the fight. Rocky vows to avenge him, and prepares to take on the Russian heavyweight in his own country. Drama sequel, directed by and starring Sylvester Stallone. With Dolph Lundgren, Talia Shire, Carl Weathers and Brigitte Nielsen.(n)

programme.title: Face/Off
programme.desc: FBI agent Sean Archer captures terrorist Castor Troy, the man who killed his son. While Troy is in a coma, Archer has the crook's face surgically grafted onto his own so he can go undercover and locate a bomb planted somewhere in Los Angeles. But then Troy regains consciousness - and in turn takes on Archer's identity. John Woo's action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Travolta, Joan Allen, Gina Gershon and Dominique Swain.(n)

programme.title: Masters of the Universe
programme.desc: The heroic warrior He-Man sets out to bring an end to the evil Skeletor's reign of terror, but is transported to Earth by a cosmic key, with his arch enemy's henchman in hot pursuit. Fantasy adventure, starring Dolph Lundgren, Frank Langella, Meg Foster and Billy Barty.(n)

programme.title: Hyena Road
programme.desc: Adept Canadian sharpshooter Ryan Sanders and his unit are forced to take refuge with an village elder while on the run from Taliban fanatics in Afghanistan. Resigned to their fate, the soldiers anxiously wait for the old man to betray them to his countrymen, but instead he saves their lives, then disappears without a trace. When Sanders reports this unusual turn of events on his return to Kandahar, seasoned intelligence officer Pete Mitchell is convinced the sniper has happened upon the legendary Afghan freedom fighter known as the Ghost, and enlists Sanders' aid in tracking the man down once again to assist in the war effort. Military drama, starring Rossif Sutherland and director Paul Gross.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.desc: As hobbits Frodo and Sam near the end of their journey into the dark lands of Mordor to destroy the One Ring, the evil Sauron unleashes the full might of his armies on Middle-earth. Meanwhile, Aragorn must fulfil his destiny of becoming king by leading his people into a climactic battle with the forces of darkness. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen and Sean Astin.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: The amnesiac assassin is living quietly in hiding, until his former employers come after him again and murder his girlfriend. A CIA operation has ended in disaster, and those responsible intend to clear their names by implicating Bourne. As the former secret agent tries to evade the hitmen on his trail, he also struggles to piece together the truth about his past. Action thriller sequel, starring Matt Damon, Brian Cox, Joan Allen and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Cloverfield
programme.desc: A gigantic monster of unknown origin rises from the sea and attacks New York. As the military throws everything they have at the creature to little effect, five survivors set off on a dangerous journey across the city to rescue a friend. One of the group documents their journey on a video camera, creating a first-hand record of the carnage. Found-footage thriller, starring Michael Stahl-David and Lizzy Caplan.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.desc: As hobbits Frodo and Sam near the end of their journey into the dark lands of Mordor to destroy the One Ring, the evil Sauron unleashes the full might of his armies on Middle-earth. Meanwhile, Aragorn must fulfil his destiny of becoming king by leading his people into a climactic battle with the forces of darkness. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen and Sean Astin.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy

A CIA operation has ended in disaster, and those responsible intend to clear their names by implicating Bourne. As the former secret agent tries to evade the hitmen on his trail, he also struggles to piece together the truth about his past. Action thriller sequel, starring Matt Damon, Brian Cox, Joan Allen and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Spy

Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Loss of Faith
programme.desc: A crime writer is drawn into intrigue and danger while investigating the kidnapping of a baby boy and the murder of the child's wealthy father. Mystery thriller, starring John Ritter, Michele Scarabelli, Daphne Zuniga and Roddy McDowall.(n)

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: The captain of an American destroyer in the South Atlantic is still recovering from the sinking of his previous vessel. He tries to outwit a cunning German U-boat commander, but comes to respect the courage of his enemy. However, his crew fears he is not up to the challenge of defeating his opponent. Second World War thriller, starring Robert Mitchum, Curt Jurgens, Theodore Bikel and David Hedison.(n)

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: An imprisoned art thief and forger learns that his son is dying, and applies for early release. While his request is granted, he learns that the shady characters who granted his freedom want him to assist them in a daring heist, leaving him torn between carrying out the robbery and making his son's last wishes come true. Crime thriller, starring John Travolta and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: Premiere. A trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who is not as helpless as he seems, and their hopes of walking away with a massive fortune do not go to plan. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette.(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette.(n)

programme.title: What Lies Beneath
programme.desc: A doctor's wife recovering from a car accident is troubled by terrifying visions of a ghostly girl who seems to be asking for help from beyond the grave. While her husband thinks the experiences are the result of her recent trauma, a psychiatrist urges her to communicate with the spirit. Supernatural thriller, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Harrison Ford, Diana Scarwid and Joe Morton.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: An unstable Vietnam veteran cop teams up with a by-the-book Los Angeles police detective to investigate the apparent suicide of the daughter of a wealthy businessman, leading them to a violent and bloody confrontation with a ruthless drug cartel under the control of a retired US general. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Mitchell Ryan and Tom Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Headstrong cop Martin Riggs and his cautious partner Roger Murtaugh stumble across a plot by a South African diplomat to launder drugs money by shipping gold coins into the US via his embassy. Protected by diplomatic immunity, the crook looks certain to evade the law - while his chief henchman has a connection to Riggs' traumatic past. Action thriller sequel, with Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Joe Pesci, Joss Ackland, Derrick O'Connor and Patsy Kensit.(n)

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: Premiere. A trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who is not as helpless as he seems, and their hopes of walking away with a massive fortune do not go to plan. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette.(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Hooligan
programme.desc: Suspended cop Michael Clarke is tasked with infiltrating an infamous London gang and bringing down its leader. British crime drama, starring Kris Johnson and Patrick Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Bugsy
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about New York gangster Bugsy Siegel, who was sent to Los Angeles to take over the West Coast rackets, but fell for a glamorous starlet and embarked on a business venture to turn Las Vegas into a gamblers' paradise. Starring Warren Beatty, Annette Bening, Harvey Keitel and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Sisters
programme.desc: Two sisters tire of their mother's alcoholism and a string of her abusive boyfriends, and plot to kill her. Thriller, starring Abigail Breslin, Georgie Henley and Mira Sorvino.(n)

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet.(n)

programme.title: Camino
programme.desc: A photographer ventures deep into the jungles of Colombia to document a group of missionaries. However, when she witnesses the leader of the group committing a horrific crime, she faces a battle for survival to make it back to civilisation with the evidence before his followers have her killed. Action thriller, starring Zoe Bell and Nacho Vigalondo.(n)

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. To break their stranglehold on the city, the FBI sends in a chemical weapons expert and a jailed SAS veteran, chosen because he is the only man to have ever escaped from the infamous penitentiary. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris.(n)

programme.title: Careful What You Wish For
programme.desc: A teenager gets more than he bargained for after entering into an affair with the wife of an investment banker, as a suspicious death and substantial life insurance policy embroil him in a scandal. Thriller, starring Nick Jonas, Dermot Mulroney and Isabel Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Every Secret Thing
programme.desc: When a young child goes missing, suspicion falls on two teenagers previously convicted for killing a baby. Thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks, Diane Lane and Dakota Fanning.(n)

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: The Trust
programme.desc: Two bumbling police officers working in the evidence room of a Las Vegas station are surprised to discover a bail receipt for an unusually high sum of money. They hatch a plan to find out where this money came from, and steal it for themselves. Comedy thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Elijah Wood and Jerry Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Hanna
programme.desc: A former CIA agent raises his daughter alone in the wilderness of Finland, teaching her to be the world's deadliest assassin. When she turns 16, she is sent to carry out her one intended mission, but as she travels the world in search of her target, she is pursued by a CIA operative with a link to her mysterious past. Action thriller, with Saoirse Ronan, Cate Blanchett and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: A gangster in 1970s Boston agrees to collaborate with an FBI agent in the hope of eliminating their common enemy - the Italian Mafia. However, the arrangement soon spirals out of control as the mobster uses his insider knowledge to outwit the law and consolidate his own power. Fact-based gangster drama, starring Johnny Depp, Benedict Cumberbatch, Joel Edgerton, Dakota Johnson and Kevin Bacon.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama following the last years of John Dillinger, whose run of bank robberies and daring prison escapes in the 1930s make him both America's most wanted criminal and a hero to a public struggling through the Depression. His career is soon to be cut short by the birth of the FBI, which assigns its most celebrated agent to bring him to justice. Directed by Michael Mann and starring Johnny Depp, Christian Bale and Marion Cotillard.(n)

programme.title: Hanna
programme.desc: A former CIA agent raises his daughter alone in the wilderness of Finland, teaching her to be the world's deadliest assassin. When she turns 16, she is sent to carry out her one intended mission, but as she travels the world in search of her target, she is pursued by a CIA operative with a link to her mysterious past. Action thriller, with Saoirse Ronan, Cate Blanchett and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: How to Steal a Million
programme.desc: A woman hires a burglar to steal one of her grandfather's forged sculptures from a prestigious Paris museum before it can be exposed publicly as a fake, unaware the man is actually a detective investigating the family. However, the cop suffers a crisis of conscience when he finds himself falling for the woman. Crime comedy, starring Audrey Hepburn, Peter O'Toole, Charles Boyer, Eli Wallach and Hugh Griffith.(n)

programme.title: Moonstruck
programme.desc: An Italian-American widow agrees to marry an older man - only to fall head over heels in love with his younger brother, leaving her facing an impossible choice. Romantic comedy, starring Cher in an Oscar-winning role, with Nicolas Cage, Olympia Dukakis and Danny Aiello.(n)

programme.title: All Roads Lead to Rome
programme.desc: A teacher is reunited with her ex-boyfriend while staying in an Italian village. The former lovers are forced to work together when her teenage daughter and his 80-year-old mother steal a car and run away to Rome together, the former hoping to return home to her boyfriend and the latter planning to remarry against her son's wishes. Romantic comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Raoul Bova and Claudia Cardinale.(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A woman joins a campaign to gain the right to vote in 1912. She and her allies find their peaceful protests accomplishing little in the face of an unwavering state, so resort to increasingly violent measures, risking everything they have in the pursuit of political justice. Period drama, starring Carey Mulligan, Helena Bonham Carter, Anne-Marie Duff and Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: Carousel
programme.desc: A criminal struggling to support his pregnant wife dies during a botched armed robbery, but is given the chance to return to life 15 years later to help his family and teach his daughter a valuable lesson. Adaptation of Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical, starring Gordon MacRae, Shirley Jones, Cameron Mitchell, Barbara Ruick and Gene Lockhart.(n)

programme.title: The Truman Show
programme.desc: A man is unaware his uneventful life is really a sham, and his every move is being secretly filmed and broadcast to the world as part of a 24-hour TV soap. However, a series of unforeseen events leads him to question the nature of his existence. Peter Weir's media satire, starring Jim Carrey, Natascha McElhone, Laura Linney, Noah Emmerich and Ed Harris.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo.(n)

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: A troubled philosophy professor begins teaching at a small town college, but struggles to find any meaning in his life. He finds some measure of happiness in his friendship with a student, and when they overhear a stranger's conversation, it spurs the tortured academic on to a course of action that changes everything. Woody Allen's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone and Parker Posey.(n)

programme.title: I Saw the Light
programme.desc: Biopic of influential country singer Hank Williams, exploring his tempestuous marriage and addiction to alcohol and painkillers. With Tom Hiddleston and Elizabeth Olsen.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo.(n)

programme.title: Burnt
programme.desc: An inventive chef's unconventional methods make him the toast of Paris, but his career is derailed by an alcohol and drugs-fuelled meltdown. An old friend offers him a second chance by hiring him to take over the kitchens of an exclusive London restaurant, but has a hard time keeping his acerbic nature in check. Drama, starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller, Daniel Bruhl, Emma Thompson and Uma Thurman.(n)

programme.title: Kinsey
programme.desc: Fact-based drama exploring the life and work of biologist Alfred Kinsey, who set out to study sexual practices in America. Concerned by the lack of scientific data available on the subject, he conducts a comprehensive series of interviews to document the full gamut of human sexuality - but is not prepared for the public outrage that greets his research. Starring Liam Neeson, Laura Linney, Chris O'Donnell and Peter Sarsgaard.(n)

programme.title: A Passage to India
programme.desc: A headstrong upper-class Englishwoman accuses an Indian doctor of sexual assault when she visits India for the first time, exposing snobbery and inter-racial tensions during the British Raj. David Lean's period drama, adapted from the EM Forster novel, starring Judy Davis, Victor Banerjee, Peggy Ashcroft, Alec Guinness, Nigel Havers, James Fox, Art Malik and Saeed Jaffrey.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Salazar's Revenge: Special
programme.desc: Sky Cinema takes a look at the fifth instalment in the swashbuckling series, starring Johnny Depp, Javier Bardem and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: The Book of Love
programme.desc: A widowed New Orleans architect strikes up an unlikely relationship with a teenage runaway. Drama, starring Jason Sudeikis, Maisie Williams and Jessica Biel.(n)

programme.title: The Longest Ride
programme.desc: A rodeo rider and a college student fall in love, but begin to question whether they have a future together as their dreams lead them in different directions. They form an unexpected friendship with an old man, whose decades-long tale of love provides them with fresh inspiration. Romantic drama based on the novel by Nicholas Sparks, starring Britt Robertson, Scott Eastwood and Alan Alda.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
programme.desc: An awkward teenager shuns all kinds of social interaction, apart from making films with his best friend. His well-meaning mother urges him to spend time with a girl who has been diagnosed with leukaemia, and they unexpectedly develop a firm friendship. However, his life is changed forever as her condition gets worse. Comedy drama based on Jesse Andrews' novel, starring Thomas Mann, RJ Cyler and Olivia Cooke.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Heartburn
programme.desc: A cookery writer falls in love with a reporter she meets at a wedding, and gets married. She sacrifices her career to devote herself to family life, but during her second pregnancy, she becomes aware her husband is having an affair. Mike Nichols' comedy drama, starring Meryl Streep, Jack Nicholson, Jeff Daniels, Maureen Stapleton and Stockard Channing, and featuring Kevin Spacey in his movie debut.(n)

programme.title: Always
programme.desc: The ghost of a daredevil pilot who was killed while fighting a raging forest fire is unable to rest until he helps his successor face the challenges of the job - and persuade his heartbroken girlfriend to accept her loss and move on with her life. Romantic fantasy, directed by Steven Spielberg and starring Richard Dreyfuss, Holly Hunter, John Goodman and Audrey Hepburn.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
programme.desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneer Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor at Trinity College, Cambridge, Professor GH Hardy. Biographical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Malcolm Sinclair.(n)

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: Biopic of the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson, following the singer-songwriter at two periods in his life. In the 1960s, he is at his creative peak, but haunted by inner demons that take their toll on his mental health. By the 1980s, he is a broken man dominated by a shady doctor, until a new relationship offers him a chance at recovery. Starring John Cusack, Paul Dano, Paul Giamatti and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Ice Princess
programme.desc: A teenager with a promising academic future causes consternation for her family when she sets her sights on becoming a professional ice skater. Luckily, a former champion of the sport is on hand to offer training and advice. Comedy drama, starring Michelle Trachtenberg, Kim Cattrall, Joan Cusack and Hayden Panettiere, alongside a host of professional skaters.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out: Special
programme.desc: The making of the Pixar animation, taking viewers inside the mind of a youngster as she copes with the emotional upheaval of moving to a new town and new school.(n)

programme.title: Coraline
programme.desc: A bored youngster finds a secret door leading to a magical world inhabited by idealised versions of her family and neighbours. Frustrated with her dull real life, she is tempted to stay in this new home - but she soon discovers there is a horrifying price to be paid. Stop-motion animated fantasy based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with the voices of Dakota Fanning and Teri Hatcher.(n)

programme.title: Maya the Bee Movie
programme.desc: A curious young bee befriends a number of other insects, despite her hive's strict rules on not associating with outsiders. When some of the Queen bee's royal jelly is stolen, she is accused of the crime and needs the help of her friends to track down the real culprits. Animated adventure based on Waldemar Bonsels' children's book, with the voices of Coco Jack Gillies and Kodi Smit-McPhee.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: The Meltdown
programme.desc: Sid the sloth, Manny the mammoth and Diego the sabre-toothed tiger grimly realise the good life is about to come to an abrupt end as flood waters threaten their homes. However, a vulture suggests they could turn an old giant tree into a boat and make their escape, so the three friends set off in search of it. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo and Denis Leary.(n)

programme.title: The Angry Birds Movie
programme.desc: Outsider Red does not fit in among his island community, but he is the only one to smell a rat when a fleet of green pigs pitch up. Animation, with the voice of Jason Sudeikis.(n)

Comedy drama, starring Michelle Trachtenberg, Kim Cattrall, Joan Cusack and Hayden Panettiere, alongside a host of professional skaters.(n)

programme.title: Kermit's Swamp Years
programme.desc: The fast-talking frog sets out in pursuit of a kidnapper who has abducted his friend. Leaving the safety of his marshland home, he follows a trail that leads him to the bright lights of Hollywood - but he also has to contend with an evil scientist along the way. Muppet comedy adventure, with Christian Kebbel and the voices of Steve Whitmire, Dave Goelz and Bill Baretta.(n)

programme.title: Scooby-Doo
programme.desc: The hapless hound and his chums reunite after a bitter break-up to solve a baffling mystery in the ghost-themed tourist resort of Spooky Island, whose owner is convinced he has a genuine haunting on his hands. Live-action comedy adventure based on the cartoon series, starring Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr, Linda Cardellini and Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed
programme.desc: The amateur detectives attend the grand opening of a museum in their honour, featuring the costumes from all the fake monsters they exposed. The exhibits are stolen by a masked villain, who sets about re-creating all the gang's worst enemies. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr and Linda Cardellini.(n)

programme.title: Kermit's Swamp Years

Muppet comedy adventure, with Christian Kebbel and the voices of Steve Whitmire, Dave Goelz and Bill Baretta.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the latest trip into JK Rowling's wizarding world, including interviews with stars Eddie Redmayne and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Minions: Sky Movies Special
programme.desc: A special look at the hotly anticipated Despicable Me spin-off, featuring the voices of Sandra Bullock and Jon Hamm.(n)

programme.title: Moana: Special
programme.desc: A look at the animated Disney adventure featuring the voices of Dwayne Johnson and Jemaine Clement.(n)

programme.title: Horton Hears a Who
programme.desc: A kindly elephant hears a cry of help coming from a speck of dust and discovers the minuscule city of Whoville. As he tries to help its citizens, the other animals begin to question his sanity, and the evil Kangaroo incites them to turn against the do-gooder. Animated adaptation of Dr Seuss's book, with the voices of Jim Carrey, Steve Carell, Carol Burnett, Seth Rogen and Will Arnett.(n)

programme.title: Survive the Serengeti: Against the Wild 2
programme.desc: When their plane crash-lands in the African bush, two bickering siblings find themselves force to rely on their wits - and their courageous dog - to help them conquer their fears and survive. Adventure, starring Jeri Ryan, John Paul Ruttan and Ella Ballentine.(n)

programme.title: Spooky Buddies
programme.desc: A gang of talking puppies explores a spooky mansion, where an evil wizard is up to no good. The daring dogs have to save the world from his villainous plot, and receive some unexpected help from a friendly ghost. Family adventure, starring Harland Williams and Dylan Sprayberry, with the voices of Frankie Jonas and G Hannelius.(n)

programme.title: Capture the Flag
programme.desc: A young surfer and his friends try to prevent a devious plan to change the course of history when a ruthless billionaire sets out to stop the moon landings from happening, so that he can gain control of a valuable energy source. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Sam Fink, Phillipa Alexander and Lorraine Pilkington.(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book: Special
programme.desc: The making of Jon Favreau's reimagining of the Disney classic, featuring the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Scarlett Johanssen.(n)

Animated adaptation of Dr Seuss's book, with the voices of Jim Carrey, Steve Carell, Carol Burnett, Seth Rogen and Will Arnett.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to stage his own death to escape his cruel father, and embarks on a series of adventures accompanied by a runaway slave in 19th-century Mississippi. Disney adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale, starring Elijah Wood, Courtney B Vance, Robbie Coltrane, Jason Robards, Dana Ivey, Anne Heche and Ron Perlman.(n)

programme.title: The Iron Giant
programme.desc: A huge robot falls from outer space and crash-lands in a small American town, terrifying the locals with its fearsome appearance. The kindly giant is befriended by a lonely youngster - but trouble looms on the horizon when a corrupt government agent sets his sights on destroying the visitor. Family animated adventure based on the children's story by poet Ted Hughes. With the voices of Vin Diesel, Eli Marienthal, Jennifer Aniston and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: The Hollow Point
programme.desc: Premiere. A hard-drinking sheriff and his deputy are pitted against a sadistic cartel hitman. Crime thriller, starring Patrick Wilson, Ian McShane and John Leguizamo.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword - Behind the Scenes
programme.desc: Alex Zane visits the set of Guy Ritchie and Jude Law's epic action adventure to see what it takes to bring King Arthur to life.(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Premiere. Calamity ensues when two party-loving brothers attempt to find respectable dates for their sister's Hawaii wedding. Comedy, starring Zac Efron and Anna Kendrick.(n)

programme.title: Rock Dog
programme.desc: A wide-eyed hound leaves his village home to pursue his rock star dream in the big city. Animated family adventure, featuring the voices of Luke Wilson, Eddie Izzard and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Premiere. Twentysomething gun runners David Packouz and Efraim Diveroli win a $300million contract from the Pentagon to arm America's allies in Afghanistan. Fact based comedy-drama, starring Miles Teller, Jonah Hill and Bradley Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Cafe Society
programme.desc: In the 1930s, a Bronx youngster heads to Hollywood and falls for the beautiful secretary of his powerful agent uncle. Woody Allen's romantic comedy, starring Steve Carell, Jesse Eisenberg and Kristen Stewart.(n)

programme.desc: The making of the new Tom Cruise monster flick, which co-stars Russell Crowe, Annabelle Wallis and Sofia Boutella.(n)
