programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Gorillas in the Mist. Stan spends some quality time with Steve at the local zoo, but things go horribly wrong when Steve slips into a gorilla exhibit. Meanwhile, Roger bets Hayley that he can become a great country singer, and sets out to write the most heartbreaking song of all time(n)

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Easy Commercial, Easy Gommercial. To keep pace with a rival restaurateur, Bob hires a documentarian to shoot a Super Bowl commercial and a former pro-football star to act as celebrity spokesman(n)

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: The Frond Files. On a visit to school, Bob and Linda discover their children's essays about Wagstaff to be wildly creative and quite offensive(n)

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Mazel Tina. Tina doesn't make the cut on the guest list for a classmate's Bat Mitzvah, but gets to attend as part of the catering staff when Bob and the family are hired for the event, where she's still excited about the prospect of scoping out the boys from other schools who will be there(n)

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Uncle Teddy. Bob's friend Teddy babysits for the kids when Bob and Linda attend an out-of-town burger convention, and with the parents away, Teddy goes all out to earn the coveted title of "Uncle Teddy"(n)

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Kids Rob a Train. During a family train trip, Louise, Gene and Tina are seated in a separate car from their parents, so rebellious Louise coaxes her siblings into stealing the entire chocolate cache from the restaurant compartment. Meanwhile, Bob and Linda get into a wine taste-off with a pretentious pair of oenophiles(n)

programme.sub-title: Tom Tucker: The Man and His Dream
programme.desc: Tom Tucker: The Man and His Dream. When Peter decides to become a famous actor, he becomes Tom Tucker's agent as his first step toward stardom. Meanwhile, Chris dates a girl who looks disturbingly like a member of the Griffin household(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Be Careful What You Fish For
programme.desc: Be Careful What You Fish For. When Peter and the guys try to salvage a sunken Mercedes-Benz, Peter half-heartedly promises a favour to a helpful dolphin. Soon the dolphin moves to Quahog, outstays his welcome at Peter's and moves into Cleveland's house across the street. Peter tries to reunite the dolphin with his ex-wife in hopes that he'll return to the ocean, but his plan backfires and the whole dolphin family moves into Cleveland's(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Burning Down the Bayit. Mort, Peter and Quagmire play with fire when they hatch a plan to save Mort's struggling pharmacy(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Killer Queen. Peter and Chris cross paths with a serial killer who targets overweight kids when they go to a fat camp. Meanwhile, Stewie is traumatised by the frightening cover of a Queen album(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Forget-Me-Not. Peter, Brian, Joe and Quagmire have an accident on their way to the Drunken Clam. When they wake up, Quahog is deserted and they can't remember who they are. Then Joe and Quagmire see a poster that leads them to believe it was Peter who emptied Quahog(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: You Can't Do That on Television, Peter
programme.desc: You Can't Do That on Television, Peter. After Peter's favourite children's television show gets cancelled, he takes matters into his own hands by creating and starring in his own show for kids. Meg begins an internship at the hospital with Dr Hartman(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Mr. and Mrs. Stewie. Stewie meets a girl who's just as precocious as he is, and it turns out that they have much in common including a love of advanced weaponry. Meanwhile, Lois is tired of being crushed in bed by the sleeping Peter, so she gets twin beds. This upsets Peter, who needs to cuddle to fall asleep(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Leggo My Meg-O. Meg goes to Paris with her friend Ruth—and they're promptly kidnapped by human traffickers. But Stewie just might have the sleuthing savvy and electronic wherewithal to find them. Brian joins him on the rescue mission(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Tea Peter. Peter joins the Tea Party and campaigns to shut down Quahog's municipal government after his illegal business is closed. His campaign succeeds, but it's his tycoon father-in-law, Carter Pewterschmidt, who reaps the benefits(n)

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Hot Water. Principal Lewis persuades Stan to invest in a hot tub to wash away the stresses and strains of work. But when Stan's hot tub turns out to have a mind of its own, he sinks deeper and deeper under its spell(n)

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Hurricane!. In an unprecedented Animation Domination crossover event, a storm hits the towns of Stoolbend, Quahog, and Langley Falls. When the Smiths decide to stay home, they must fight tooth-and-nail to survive(n)

programme.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors
programme.desc: Michael Mann, the film-maker behind Heat, Ali and Miami Vice, discusses his directing career, as well as his most memorable onset experiences and the secrets to success.(n)

programme.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors
programme.desc: Bryan Singer chats about his movie-making career, reveals the secrets behind the making of films including X-Men, Superman Returns, The Usual Suspects and Valkyrie.(n)

programme.title: Julius Caesar
programme.desc: An honourable Roman is drawn into a conspiracy of senators, who intend to murder a triumphant war leader before he can appoint himself king. However, when an ally of their victim turns the people against them, a war erupts that will determine the fate of the empire. Drama adapted from Shakespeare's play, starring Charlton Heston, Jason Robards and John Gielgud.(n)

programme.title: Torpedo Run
programme.desc: A submarine commander is sent to destroy a Japanese aircraft carrier during the Second World War, but accidentally blows up a ship holding Allied prisoners that the enemy was using as a shield. Learning his wife and daughter were among those killed, he becomes obsessed with destroying the carrier. Adventure, starring Glenn Ford, Ernest Borgnine and Diane Brewster.(n)

programme.title: Charro
programme.desc: Reformed gunslinger Jess Wade is framed by his former cronies for the theft of a jewel-encrusted cannon from the Mexican revolutionary forces. Western, starring Elvis Presley, Ina Balin, Victor French and James B Sikking.(n)

programme.title: The Last Challenge
programme.desc: A marshal who acquired a reputation as the fastest quick draw in the West in his youth is challenged to a gunfight. Seeing something of his younger self in his cocky opponent, the lawman tries to persuade the gunslinger to give up a life of violence. Western, starring Glenn Ford, Chad Everett and Angie Dickinson.(n)

programme.title: Big Jake
programme.desc: Bandits attack a Texas ranch and kidnap a boy, demanding a $1million ransom. However, they have reckoned without the intervention of the youngster's tough grandfather, who sets out on the trail with the aid of his two sons, a cunning tracker and his faithful dog. Western, starring John Wayne, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Hara, Chris Mitchum and Patrick Wayne.(n)

programme.title: Gunsight Ridge
programme.desc: An undercover agent for a stagecoach company plagued by bandits takes over as a town's sheriff when the previous lawman is killed by the outlaws' leader. He sets out to bring the criminal to justice, unaware he is masquerading as a respectable mine owner. Western, starring Joel McCrea, Mark Stevens and Joan Weldon.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
programme.desc: Captain Kirk is framed for the assassination of the Klingon head of state just as the Federation is about to make peace with their old enemies. As Kirk and Dr McCoy are banished to an icy prison planet, Spock tries to uncover the identity of the real killers. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley, Christopher Plummer, with appearances by Christian Slater and Michael Dorn from Star Trek: The Next Generation.(n)

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket
programme.desc: Raw recruits undergo harsh training under a domineering Marine drill sergeant after being called up for service in the Vietnam War, but his brutal methods lead to the breakdown of one of his cadets. Eventually, some of the fully trained soldiers get their first taste of combat in 1968. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Matthew Modine, Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio and R Lee Ermey.(n)

programme.title: Highlander: Endgame
programme.desc: Immortal warrior Connor MacLeod retreats to a remote sanctuary after his adopted daughter is killed by a crazed priest who has been seeking revenge on him for centuries. When the cleric destroys the haven, Connor must turn to his kinsman Duncan for help in defeating their enemy. Fantasy sequel, with Christopher Lambert and Adrian Paul.(n)

programme.title: Conspiracy Theory with Jesse Ventura
programme.desc: Jesse examines the causes of the financial meltdown and how stock market prices are manipulated.(n)

programme.title: Conspiracy Theory with Jesse Ventura
programme.desc: How corporations are buying water rights, giving them control over the people living depending on the sources they obtain.(n)

programme.desc: Interview with Joel Schumacher, director of Falling Down, The Lost Boys and A Time to Kill.(n)

programme.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors

programme.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors
programme.desc: Interview with Doug Liman, director of The Bourne Identity, Mr & Mrs Smith and Edge of Tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors
programme.desc: Milos Forman chats about his career, including his Oscar-winning films One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest and Amadeus, as well as Man on the Moon and The People vs Larry Flynt.(n)

programme.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors
programme.desc: Interview with Paul Schrader, director of The Walker and Blue Collar, and writer of Taxi Driver and Raging Bull.(n)

programme.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors
programme.desc: Interviews with leading film-makers in which they talk about their careers. British director Alan Parker discusses his movies, which include Midnight Express, Come See the Paradise, Angela's Ashes, Bugsy Malone, Fame and Evita.(n)

programme.title: Rio Lobo
programme.desc: A former Union Army colonel heads for Texas to recover a shipment of gold bullion stolen from a payroll train during the American Civil War and settle a few old scores along the way. programme.title: War
programme.desc: An FBI agent whose partner and family were killed by a notorious assassin sets out for revenge as the elusive triggerman sparks a sprawling gang war between the triads and the yakuza in the feature debut from prolific music video director Phillip Atwell. FBI sgent Jack Crawford (Jason Statham) is a man driven by vengeance. After his partner, Tom Lone (Terry Chen), and his family fell to bullets fired by infamous hitman Rogue (Jet Li), Crawford makes it his life mission to ferret out the slippery killer. Complications arise when it begins to appear as if Rogue has a mission of his own to carry out, and as triad boss Chang (John Lone) prepares for all-out war against yakuza boss Shiro (Ryo Ishibashi), Crawford and Rogue also come face to face as the secrets of the past emerge in a hail of gunfire(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Paradigm. Powerful American drama about the investigation and prosecution of crime. A female veteran of the second Gulf War is found murdered, and the evidence points to the sister of a former inmate of Abu Ghraib prison. When DAs McCoy and Southerlyn begin to prosecute, however, they discover that the suspect's lawyer plans to defend his client as an enemy combatant, and subject only to the terms of the Geneva Convention(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Saving Private Leo. All loyal Charmed fans are aware that Leo Wyatt (Brian Krause), the Whitelighter (guardian angel) of the Charmed Ones, is the spirit of a man who passed away in 1942. In this episode, Leo's previous life catches up with him, as two soldiers who fought with Leo in WWII return from the dead with revenge in mind. Unless Leo takes drastic quickly, his wife, Piper (Holly Marie Combs), will be the latest "casualty." Meanwhile, the demon-possessed Cole (Julian McMahon) connives to remove his new bride, Phoebe (Alyssa Milano), from her sisters' good influence(n)

They are still blissfully(?) unaware that the soon-to-be Source is their own brother-in-law, Cole (Julian McMahon).
